author: {'steamid': '76561198136507502', 'num_games_owned': 355, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 781, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 496, 'last_played': 1702840157}
review:
NTTE- это тот самый проект, который из маленькой флеш-игры перерос в нехилый инди-экшен с элементами головоломки. Однако некоторое я высказать о РЕМАСТЕРЕ должен, что мне не очень понравилось. Это механика управления телекинезом и отталкивания за зеленого клона. Честно сказать, в оригинале они были реализованы(Для клавиатуры и мыши) гораздо удобнее, что давало больший простор для управления мышью, а теперь мышка прикована к кругу и такое пошло отлично на геймпад, вот только для клавы с мышкой пришлось адаптироваться снова. Радуют ещё достижения, которые дают тебе не хилый такой челлендж(Speedrun, Mmeyes indeerun и Steedrun), но их мало, что немного расстроило. Порадовало большое количество механик и связка всех уровней в один большой сюжет. 
8/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198086657367', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 14, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 14, 'last_played': 1577662609}

review: Nice little platform. Some levels are pretty tough but nothing you couldn't learn to beat. Biggest minus comes from how controller worked. I had to switch from controller to keyboard and mouse in the middle of the game because aiming felt too hard and inaccurate.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006053403', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 51, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 51, 'last_played': 1576599284}
review: Alright, this review is hard for me because I genuinely love the writing and vibe of this game, but an unfun difficulty and some frustrating design choices bring it down. To clarify, I LOVE difficult games when they are done properly. Soulsborne games have a difficulty that makes you want to come back and try again. I spent hours in cuphead and loved almost every second of it. This ones difficulty and sometimes frustratingly punishing (although thankfully this is a much less common occurance) handling of checkpoints just makes me want to stop playing. I don't know enough about game design to explain why sadly, but I was put off enough to feel obligated to write this review in hopes that when this game gets a sequel (because PLEASE, I need more of this plot or lack thereof) they dial it back a bit on how punishing it is.

author: {'steamid': '76561197996222034', 'num_games_owned': 1115, 'num_reviews': 436, 'playtime_forever': 272, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 145, 'last_played': 1576621185}

author: {'steamid': '76561198013146396', 'num_games_owned': 1655, 'num_reviews': 2129, 'playtime_forever': 246, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 246, 'last_played': 1575720490}
review:
Не люблю эту игру. Пытаюсь понять, почему некомфортно, но чёткого определения не получилось дать.

То ли сюжет с бесконечно затянутой завязкой утомляет. "У попа была собака, он её любил..." - и заново, заново, только на другой локации.

То ли механика не зашла. Признаться, по ощущением игра не так сложна, как Super meat boy, к примеру. Но всё равно бесконечно крутить стик геймпада в этом случае удовольствия не доставило.

Но вот технически Remastered гораздо лучше оригинала - как минимум нет той сраной проблемы с разрешением экрана и поддержкой геймпада.

Раз не зашло, рекомендовать не буду. Кого я обману?

author: {'steamid': '76561198024138776', 'num_games_owned': 741, 'num_reviews': 429, 'playtime_forever': 86, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 42, 'last_played': 1570143721}
review:
Wymagająca platformówka ze specyficznym poczuciem humoru, w której odwiedza nas nasze przyszłe ja, wciągając w zwariowaną historię z podróżami w czasie.

Jak przystało na taką grę, również mechanika rozgrywki jest dziwna. W ręce dostajemy laser, który pozwala nam odpychać się od różnych powierzchni, czego używamy do poruszania się po mapie. Sprawia to, że gra jest dosyć specyficzna i, jak dla mnie, frustrująca. W późniejszych etapach dostajemy różne modyfikacje wspomnianego lasera, które zmieniają mechanikę zabawy.

author: {'steamid': '76561198886227993', 'num_games_owned': 168, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 736, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 668, 'last_played': 1569783313}
review:
This game is a fleshed out version of a browser game, which means it's built on a minimalistic idea and not really meant to be a long game. Still, it works well enough to enjoy a weekend or so. Go through time with your Kamehameha Gun and platform to defeat octosharks and giant robot crabs while getting a nice assorted amount of hats along the way.

But if you get the game, do so while on sale. It's entertaining, but also pricey. Remember that at the end of the day, it's still based on a browser game, which should tell you how much quality to expect.

author: {'steamid': '76561198005151347', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 85, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9, 'last_played': 1570173225}
review:
An interesting idea for core gameplay, and it seems like effort went into coming up with variations on the theme, but one fact kills it - the gunflight (or whatever it's best called) physics are counterintuitive and unnatural. (For example, firing down provides you with an upward boost. If you jump and then boost, you get about half as high as without the jump.) It's something I could probably get used to, but I find I have little interest in doing so.

The humor is...fine. If you thought Newgrounds animations of hemorrhaging cupcakes were hilarious, this will probably amuse.

author: {'steamid': '76561198292211577', 'num_games_owned': 330, 'num_reviews': 79, 'playtime_forever': 644, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 433, 'last_played': 1678045015}
review: Niedługa, ale za to świetna platformówka, w której czarny humor i dopasowana do niego gra aktorska pełnią role jednych z największych zalet. Gra prezentuje się również naprawdę ładnymi, różnorodnymi lokacjami, ciekawie zaprojektowaną walką i całkiem niezłą ścieżką dźwiękową, a dodatkowo w poziomach została ukryta solidna ilość znajdziek dla graczy, którzy szukają nieco większego wyzwania. Jedynym minusem produkcji jest fakt, iż twórcy zdefiniowali poziom trudności jako robienie niektórych rzeczy na styk, a niektóre mechaniki nie zostały dopracowane tak, aby takie czynności dało się wykonać bezproblemowo. Co prawda takich sytuacji nie ma zbyt wiele, ale momentami jest to odczuwalne.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000082399', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 93, 'playtime_forever': 43, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 43, 'last_played': 1566829663}
review:
Game goes from okay to annoyingly hard and turns into a bullet hell game with a lot of cheap shots. It's also locked in 720p which is just downright pathetic for a 2015 game regardless of the art style. If it was on a console I wouldn't mind but on PC it messes with the desktop resolution as well, so have fun multi-tasking and viewing everything else in 720P as well.

Visually it looked really good, there's a lot of decent visual feedback & audio feedback to compliment it. The audio itself was good, good music but basic sound effects which were fine cause it suited the aesthetic of the game.

The gameplay was rudimentary though, pretty much just fire a laser canon in the opposite direction that you want to move the character. It had some decent platforming which I was mildly enjoying just up until the game went from that, to a crappy bullet hell game. It makes no effort to imply that it even has those kind of mechanics. If I wanted to play a bullet hell game I'd have done so. 

Maybe some day I'll revisit it in local co-op but I doubt even that will really change much.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042620952', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1382, 'playtime_forever': 90, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 90, 'last_played': 1565279797}
review:
[h1] Genre [/h1] Ein 2D Platformer mit Puzzle & Action Elementen

[h1] Story [/h1] Unser zukünftiges Ich taucht plötzlich vor uns auf, hat aber keine Zeit uns zu erzählen was los ist oder warum er hier ist. Plötzlich wird er von einer Riesen Krabbe gepackt und mitgeschleift und wir machen uns nun ans Werk uns selbst zu retten.

[h1] Gameplay [/h1] Gleich vorweg, das Spiel ist leicht frustrierend. Man kann zwar Laufen & Springen aber das bringt nicht viel. Man hat eine Laser Waffe die gleichzeitig auch als Jetpack gilt (das macht das voran kommen deutlich schwieriger). Die Einzelnen Level sind relativ kurz aber teilweise schwierig. Gegner gibt es (mit wenigen ausnahmen) nicht. In den Leveln sind Stacheln, Schluchten usw. unser Feind. Es gibt einige Nette Boss Kämpfe die wirklich Spaß machen. In den Einzelnen Leveln kann man Hüte einsammeln um unseren Charakter anders aussehen zu lassen.

[h1] Achievements [/h1] Es gibt insgesamt 9 Erfolge. Dafür muss man alle Hüte im Spiel sammeln und gewisse Bosse ohne zu sterben besiegen. Auch einige Speedrun Erfolge sind mit dabei

[h1] Pro/Contra [/h1]
+ Story Abgedreht aber Cool gemacht
+ Gute Musik
+ Witzig
+ Faire Checkpoints
+ Nette Boss Kämpfe
+ Guter Synchronsprecher
+ Steam Workshop Support
+ XBox 360 Controller Support
+ Achievements
+ Sammelkarten

- Kann sehr schnell frustrieren
- Preis ist mit 14,99€ zu Hoch

[h1] Fazit [/h1] Ein Spiel das nicht für jeden ist. Ich fand das Spiel an sich sehr frustrierend aber die Story hat mich doch motiviert weiterzuspielen

author: {'steamid': '76561198353126111', 'num_games_owned': 97, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 576, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 556, 'last_played': 1563124372}
review:
- Je to 2D parkour hra se zajímavou grafikou a jednoduchou hratelností. 
- Je to hra na styl hry Blackhole ale z větším durazem na děj.
- Ceklem se zde vyskytuje 15 levlu, 9 boss fightu.
- Je možnost hrát mapy jiných lidí nebo si vytvořit vlastní mapy

pozitiva hry:
+ Jednoduchá old school grafika 
+ Vtipné monology/dialogy
+ Je zde přítomen multiplayer
+ Možnost vytvořit vlastní úroveň nebo hrát úroveň jiného hráče 
+ Jdnoduché options hry
+ Není nutné mít drahý počítač na rozjetí této hry 
+ Plná podpora ovladače 
+ Možnost hrát v malém okně nebo ve fullscreenu

negativa hry:
- Místy se vyskytují textury o které se zaseknete
- Krátka hrací doba
- Složité získání všech achivementů
- Není možnost si zvolit náročnost hry
- Dle mého nemá cenu 15 euro, ale ve slevě není chyba tuto hru zakoupit 

- Dle mého je to skvělá hra která má něco do sebe a určitě ji můžu doporučit 

moje hodnocení: 10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198801775940', 'num_games_owned': 67, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 573, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 566, 'last_played': 1584907953}

author: {'steamid': '76561198161478437', 'num_games_owned': 109, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 741, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 712, 'last_played': 1622201667}
review:
Офигеть какая это крутая игра! Я за 14 часов игры в нее успел пройти ее 3 раза, пройти 3 пользовательских уровня, и выполнить 7/9 достижений! Мне это вкатило прям, ну не знаю, это ооооочень круто! 
Определенно стоит ее брать, но не за 349р а лучше по скидке, я бы игре дал максимум 300р.

Теперь расскажу плюсы и минусы игры:
+ Довольно простая (не считая достижений).
+ Сюжет (в некоторых моментах можно и поугарать XD).
+ Хорошая музыка.
+ Есть кооператив (но я к сожалению в него не поиграл, так бы залип еще на пару часиков)).
+ Можно играть на слабом пк.
+ Можно играть как на джостике, так и на клаве.

- Игра на 4 часа, если проходить 1 раз, и только компанию (Очень мало).
- Графика ну такое... (Небольшие размытости есть).
- Где русский язык? (Как понять сюжет, и что выкрикивает умирающий чел? Я хз...)
- Дорого.

Плюсов 6 а минусов 4. Плюсов больше, значит брать определенно стоит!

author: {'steamid': '76561198004542992', 'num_games_owned': 1219, 'num_reviews': 84, 'playtime_forever': 216, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 216, 'last_played': 1562603720}
review:
Не рекомендую покупать, но пройти можно, если игра уже имеется. Существует множество игр, выполненных на гораздо более высоком уровне и дарящих схожие ощущения.
Однако, стоит отметить довольно хороший баланс сложности и небольшие уровни держат в постоянном напряжении. Кажется, еще немного и дальше станет непроходимо - ан нет, все остается на том же уровне

author: {'steamid': '76561198095379600', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 705, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 705, 'last_played': 1562493135}
review: Not a bad game, but mediocre. I can see why it could've been popular back in the Flash game days, though it somehow missed my attention until the remaster. The main plus of NTtE is that just as you may start getting bored of the game's mechanics, rest assured they'll be changed almost completely right around the corner. The downside of this is that because of so much different gameplay setups involved, none of them are refined and the level design leaves much to be desired. Despite the remaster, the game still holds a dense Flash game aesthetic, which mostly means that a lot of it is bland semi-hand-drawn shapes, with characters being the worst offenders. Same for music - typical indie game mix of the dramatic and chiptune. Most tracks barely differ from one another. I did have my share of fun with this game, but overall, I feel there was too much frustration with unfair difficulty involved. I do believe if this remaster was more intricate and spent more time refining the mechanics and level design, this could've been a great game. As it is right now, I only recommend buying it on sale, if you're feeling particularly thirsty for some  more run-of-the-mill indie platformer experience.

author: {'steamid': '76561197977904226', 'num_games_owned': 1151, 'num_reviews': 161, 'playtime_forever': 365, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 365, 'last_played': 1560301018}
review:
TinyBuild's debut release has virtually become an icon for the team. With a simple cartoon character from the future being grabbed by a giant crab claw, hints of flash cartoon hilarity seemed apparent from the trailer's viewing.

The graphics are along the Flash quality and the controls are pretty simple. On the other hand, the game mechanics, that require of your timing and coordination with your laser gun, define the challenge that accelerates with each level completed. I can compare it with Super Meat Boy as there are more than a few levels that took many tries to finish; nevertheless satisfying to some level.

The game does get rewarding as the plot unfolds with unpredictable results, considering its dark, humorous nature. Took a few hours to finish it and can be recommended to challenge-seeking fans of platformers, who also appreciate some fresh content of hilarity, and... yes, hats!

author: {'steamid': '76561198044741485', 'num_games_owned': 188, 'num_reviews': 118, 'playtime_forever': 182, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 182, 'last_played': 1559679808}
review:
No Time To Explain is a 2D platforming game that celebrates innovation. It's fast-paced, unique, and funny.

What makes it so special is all the unique gameplay elements it implements, that often change the way you engage the level you're playing. It doesn't dwell too long on each mechanic, instead choosing to move on to the next.
The game isn't easy, but it's not cheap either. You respawn quickly and next to the jumps you fail, so you can try again right away.

This game is not without flaws, though. The hit detection is sometimes too precise or imprecise, and that can cause frustration. Also, this game is a bit challenging to control with the mouse (I believe it was developed with a controller in mind).

Still, if you like indie games with a twist, No Time To Explain is certainly no exception and it will offer you a few hours of genuine fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561198176675135', 'num_games_owned': 3350, 'num_reviews': 2843, 'playtime_forever': 149, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 134, 'last_played': 1557818728}
review:
[h1]向日葵游戏评分：6分（1-10）[/h1]
这是一款高难度平台动作游戏，玩家手中的加农炮既是武器，也是喷气背包，射击地面便会向反方向弹射，以此方式冲过重重障碍，最终击败巨大的怪兽。
游戏虽然规则简单，但操作起来很不好掌握弹射的方向和力度，需要玩家有耐心，能试错。
[h1]欢迎大家关注我们的鉴赏家：https://store.steampowered.com/curator/28763059[/h1]
[h1]关注微信公众号和头条号“向日葵游戏”获取更多资讯；官方微博：向日葵游戏评测[/h1]

review: The game itself is ok. It's just that it feels and looks like a flashgame (it actually even used to be a browser flashgame...) which you'd normally play on one of those "play free games"-websites. The average player also finishes the game within 2-3 hours and there isn't really a reason to ever play it again once you finished the game. Definitely not worth the price, not even on discount. Not to mention that this game has been part of free unlimited giveaways so many times already, so no doubt it will again. If you can't wait for such a moment, I still definitely would not pay more than 1 or 2 dollars for this game.

review:
I've been trying to play this game since I bought it over a year ago and it never loaded normally. The developer stopped respond to such game crashing problems from 2015 so this game is sadly completely abandoned.

I did not ask for a refund because I wanted to play this game so badly, which I regret now. So if you ever want to buy this game, just remember to ask for a refund when you fail to load the game.

review:
Got really stuck on [spoiler] the tunneling mole thing boss [/spoiler] boss.
I've 100% two souls games, so I'm no stranger to difficulty. 
I got so frustrated with this boss that I quit the game. 
The mechanics and atmosphere of this game are good, and I was really enjoying the game at first. But I don't think this game is good enough to keep returning to again and again. And after quitting from frustration once, I don't feel like the mechanics and atmosphere are enough to get me to return.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004565666', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 296, 'playtime_forever': 200, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 200, 'last_played': 1496710578}
review:
Creative and well-designed platformer with some moderately unique ideas, if you can get past the aesthetics.

The main mechanic is that you have a laser with insanely high recoil, and you use the recoil to jump higher, jump farther, fall slower, run faster, etc. It's not quite strong enough to fly (except underwater), but close. The beam itself is used too, to break blocks and damage bosses. Controlling your character precisely is very difficult as the slightest error in angle will send you veering off in the wrong direction, but this is by design.

The game constantly changes things up with new mechanics, most of which stick around for only one level. It'll replace your gun with a different recoil mechanic, or add gravity rotators and cake "powerups" for a puzzle level, add blocks that turn into spikes if you shoot them, etc. Because of this, along with numerous and good-enough boss battles, the gameplay never gets stale and you'll easily keep going to the (relatively short) end. Add in collectible hats and acheivements for some extra replay and youv'e got a solid game.

As for the negatives... it's pretty obvious from the trailer. The humor is mired deeply in 90s Newgrounds humor, where yelling that you're in pain counts as humor, though there's still a few parts that are genuinely funny. The graphics are also what you'd expect from a 90s flash game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197967507597', 'num_games_owned': 5656, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 400, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 400, 'last_played': 1548611207}
review:
I thought it was time to start going through my 5000+ game Steam backlog I accumlated over the past 14 or so years, so I began at random with No Time to Explain. (I seem to have both this game and the original in my library)

No Time to Explain is a pretty basic puzzle-platformer. It looks and plays like an early 2000 flash game, which it may or may not have initially been. You controller a little man who has a gun that he must use to essentially rocket-jump himself to the end of the stage avoiding various hazards like lava and spikes. Each stage is about 30 seconds long with about 5-10 stages per chapter and a boss at the end of each chapter. 

There are no enemies in the game aside from bosses but their are a few different weapons which change the way you traverse throughout the level. I really liked the different weapons as they change up the game quite a bit, although I do wish their were a few more as a lot of the levels revert back to your basic laser weapon which kind of gets stale. 

Aside from the basic gameplay loop mentined above, the game also has a few hidden "hats" throughout the game that can be discovered. Although the hats do not change the game at all and are just cosmetic in nature, they do add a nice little challenge for a completionist like myself.

Overall the game is pretty basic and not very long. I am not a big fan of the artstyle or humor, but it plays well and I quite liked the gameplay loop. I most certainly would not recommend the game at its current price of $16.99 Canadian and I probably got this game in a bundle, but at its regularly discount price of a dollar or two it is definitely worth checking out.

review:
Totalmente recomendable.

No solo sus mecanicas son muy disfrutables y adictivas, sino que su comedia e historia hacen que te emociones aun mas por seguir completando el juego.

Es mucho mas divertido si lo juegas con un amigo en el cooperativo a pesar de algunos problemas con la camara en ciertos niveles (el del chaleco de fuerza es horrible en cooperativo) porque las risas lo curan todo.

author: {'steamid': '76561198117885332', 'num_games_owned': 683, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 329, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 329, 'last_played': 1544485666}
review:
No Time To Explain is an old flash game created by tinyBuild, in which you play as a dude in a journey to save his many alternate universe selves from gigantic monsters.  NTTE is, in a single word, dated.  However unlike Super Meat Boy which has aged like wine, NTTE has started to mold and stiffen up in the years since it was relevent.

Firstly, the controls feel awkward.  NTTE demands rather precise, flowing, quick movements in order to control the gigantic lazer that propels you through each level.  However the lazer itself feels very sticky and finnicky, since the camera and player move independently of each other.  So if you need to keep the mouse near the player in order to minimize the distance it'll shift due to the screen moving, but this sets the player up to slip and screw up their boost.  Not to mention that in a later section, the lazer is replaced with a magnet-like ability.  You instead of finnicking your way through levels with a lazer, you need to guess and hope that you're launching yourself correctly while the curosr is arbitrarily limited to a certain distance away.

The levels don't fair much better either.  They're either rudimentary - as in a single spike-lined corridor is the only obstacle - or frustrating.  While none are infuriating, it feels as if whoever designed the levels had very little experience.  As of writing this review - having just beaten the game - I have no stand out memories of any individual level.  It's all become a blur.  The bosses fall prey to the same issues.  They're either hilariously simple or frustratingly obtuse.  I was stuck for nearly 15 minutes on the drillmole boss before I realized you needed to shoot it's head - not it's weak spot - when it's doing a specific attack, from a specific distance.  While they're interesting just to see, I can't say I enjoyed any of them.

Graphically and musically the game hasn't held up too well, but there's still some appeal to it.  It has a very "Newgrounds" style, and you can tell it was made by a couple of dudes having fun.  I'd say that's arguably the best part of the game.  It has a sense of intimacy and fun that many modern games don't capture, and it's almost like a kid you new from school is showing off his newest little pet game.

And for the achievement hunters, I'd say don't bother trying to 100%.  The game has a few achivements, most of which are filler or boring.  It's doable, but it isn't fun.

This game is a "youtube game".  It's a lot more fun to sit back and watch someone else play it, than it is to actually sit down and go through it.  Were I to put my feelings into a number, I'd give NTTE a 5/10 but the pricetag prevents me from recommending it.  If it goes on sale for $5, and you want some Newgrounds nostalgia I'd say go ahead and buy it.  To everyone else, if you're really interested in NTTE just watch a Let's Play.

review: Pour commencer ce jeu s'adresse à un public moins casual que les autres jeux Tiny Build.Il est  court (un peu moins de 2h pour le finir en faisant une pause vers le premier tiers du jeu) mais vaut bien une quinzaine d'euros,même si je recommanderais plutôt d'attendre une promo. Si je dis qu'il vaut son prix,c'est surtout par rapport au workshop qui vous laisse créer le ou les niveaux dont vous révez (perso moi j'adore faire des montagnes russes à base de gateaux).En gros un jeu assez durs mais aussi assez sympa puisque vous avez un checkpoint à chaque fois que vous touchez le sol.J'éspère que cette revue vous à décidé(e).

author: {'steamid': '76561198068167429', 'num_games_owned': 205, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 221, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 221, 'last_played': 1542919256}
review:
Il gioco è stupendo nonostante sia vecchiotto ma con la versione remastered sembra quasi che sia uscito non piu' di qualche mese fa.
Purtroppo il tempo che bisogna impiegare per finire la storia non è molto vista la rapida successione degli eventi, tuttavia preferisco molto un gioco in cui avvengono moltissimi fatti uno dopo l'altro (ovviamente in rapida successione) piuttosto che giochi in cui ogni 2 ore succede qualcosa.
Il gioco risulta molto divertente e se uno ha voglia puo' divertirsi a finire i nuovi achivement di cui alcuni molto strani.

author: {'steamid': '76561198264021390', 'num_games_owned': 149, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 130, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 121, 'last_played': 1590227001}
review: NTTX to dość klasyczna gra ze swojego gatunku. Platformówka, w której ruch ułatwia nam łamiąca prawa fizyki broń jest dość często spotykana. Ta gra ma jednak coś, co zatrzymało mnie przy niej na dłużej: prosta, ale dobrze i przejrzyście przedstawiona fabuła oraz poziomy z kilkoma zagadkami i wyważonym poziomem trudności sprawiają, że granie w tą grę było naprawdę przyjemnością. Jest ona dość krótka, jeśli pomijamy wszelkie easter eggi i tym podobne, ale wciąż zalecam kupić lub wygrać na giveaway tą grę - jest warta czasu, który jej poswięciłem. Polecam!

author: {'steamid': '76561198077875430', 'num_games_owned': 560, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 201, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 201, 'last_played': 1541101416}
review:
Mira, es un juego corto, que no da cientos de horas, pero tambien es un juego barato.
La mecánica tan simple como el típico rocket jump, se transforma en la base de un juego de plataformas exigente y divertido.
Con la premisa de que tu mismo del futuro vienes a buscarto para algo por lo que no hay tiempo de explicar, te adentras en un no parar de niveles que tendrás que superar, con una simple mecánica, que irá variando a lo largo del juego para hacerlo más o ameno.
Lo único que no me acaba de convencer del juego són los bosses, y es algo personal. Nunca me han gustado los bosses de los juegos de plataformas.

author: {'steamid': '76561197980949132', 'num_games_owned': 439, 'num_reviews': 222, 'playtime_forever': 37, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 37, 'last_played': 1520806516}
review:
Enjoyable platformer with interesting mechanics and boss fights. The dialog and goofy dancing of the character are what really get me and make me continually chuckle. The controls can feel a bit sluggish at times which can be frustrating at times because the game require precision movements. The game is definitely "die" and error. 

I'm not sure how long the game is as I haven't beaten it yet but I'm guessing no more than 4 hours. Get it on sale for ~ $8 and i'd say you got a good deal.

You can watch my Let's Play footage of the game over on my  [url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=a8AoXpM5Xc0&list=PL0q93Rkkmx_sEjdOzmKPYbtXW2V9yJ5PL]YouTube Channel[/url] !

author: {'steamid': '76561198115646346', 'num_games_owned': 1601, 'num_reviews': 66, 'playtime_forever': 173, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 173, 'last_played': 1541391547}
review:
一个小工作室的第一款游戏。
很标准的美式无厘头搞笑。

游戏本质为平台跳跃类，但与一般平台跳跃游戏有很大区别，游戏玩法是利用枪的后坐力来达到“飞行”的目的，几乎全程在飞，跳跃的用处并不大。

[h1]这个游戏，有很典型的欧美式游戏缺点[/h1]
它每一关都有新的机关类型，它不停的追求新奇，但是，每一种机关都没有深入发掘。
这就像一个厨师，源源不断的给顾客呈上新的菜品，有鸡肉、牛肉、羊肉、猪肉、鱼肉，然后我仔细一看，嚯！全都是烤的。
的确，每一道新菜确实是有不同的味道，但问题是，你会做烤肉，别的饭店也会做啊。与其努力寻找新的肉质类型，不如就拿一块鸡肉，反复做，变着花样做。
现今的游戏行业，想要开发新的创意越来越难了，更何况是平台跳跃类这种游戏基数就非常大的。这个游戏里所有的创意，我都在别处见过。
不是我贬低欧美游戏，欧美也有非常多优秀的游戏，而是欧美这种独立游戏普遍存在关卡设计问题，他们似乎根本就没注意到关卡是需要设计的，[spoiler]偷偷说一句，国产游戏也这样，[/spoiler]我在日式游戏里就不太能有这种感觉，就算随便在某个不为人知的论坛找一款小游戏，日本人也会试图以各种方式摆放道具，设计地形。

[h1]这个游戏，有很典型的大多数平台跳跃类游戏缺点[/h1]
有时候，不是制作人不想好好设计关卡，而是他不会设计。
这款游戏一看就是不会设计。
我有句话想问游戏作者，同样也想问steam上所有平台跳跃类游戏作者。你们设计关卡的时候，是先摆地形，再看人物能不能跳过去；还是先设计人物跳跃路线，再摆地形？
这款游戏肯定是前者，大多数平台跳跃游戏都是前者。所以，这样做的后果就是，虽然每一关看起来都不一样，但玩起来一样。
我没有针对这款游戏，在我看来，steam上没有几个合格的平台跳跃游戏，大部分都是平台跳跃冒险游戏，只做好了冒险部分，没做好平台跳跃部分。

[h1]下面这部分我写完了自己都看不下去，不建议看，但是删了又感觉可惜[/h1]
和大多数考验微操的游戏不一样，这款游戏需要用到鼠标。
这种设计是一个双刃剑。

我们可以把键盘视为线性与非线性的结合，按键是非线性的，打比方说，你无论怎么按键，是用手指按，用脚趾按，还是用舌头按，按到了A那就是A，不会产生第二种结果。
线性的部分是时间，每次按键时间的长短都是不一样的。不过，对于40帧或60帧这类固定帧游戏来说，游戏的极限操作就是精确到每帧，虽然看起来很不可思议，不过，经过反复的肌肉记忆，一名玩家可以做到精确到帧的操作。

再来看看鼠标，鼠标同样有鼠标键，也受时间影响，这与键盘是一样的，但是，鼠标还多了一样东西，那就是鼠标位置。对于鼠标来说，极限操作就是精确到每个像素点，不用说了，人类绝对做不到。
这款游戏没那么苛刻，它是以一个点为中心，再用鼠标点击屏幕的不同方向。那么这款游戏线性部分就是时间+角度。

一般的平台跳跃游戏线性因素只有两个，就是移动和跳跃按键的时间。
这款游戏有三个，移动、鼠标按键的时间，还有鼠标位置，看起来只多了一个，但这多出来的一个造成的可不只是2+1的效果。

扯了一大堆，终于可以说为什么它是双刃剑了。
微操游戏的线性因素决定了这款游戏有多大的发挥空间，也就是能做出多复杂的操作，跑步跑几帧，跳跃跳几帧，规定好了人物行进路线，再设计游戏关卡。这款游戏多出了一个线性因素，人物可以做出的动作更复杂，在关卡设计上就可以有更多套路。
然而，这种设计带来的缺点更为严重，首当其冲的就是玩起来很难受，在操作的时候需要兼顾的太多。而且，这种关卡也不够一目了然，应该怎样过关，以什么样的操作来应对特定的地形，这会让玩家很纠结。

好在，游戏关卡设计很基本，[spoiler]瞧瞧我这用词，我不说烂，我要说基本。[/spoiler]所以操作什么的就不需要考虑了，因为游戏非常简单，随随便便以什么方式都能过。

最后还是给了游戏好评，它有玩点，这就值得好评了。

review:
No Time To Explain Remastered is a very casual fun game. 
I could even don't do a review of it, because I do not have time to explain (ahah!)

The game is simple, is visually very basic, but believe me the game is not easy, feels weird to play. I do not know if is because I play on keyboard and mouse or if the controls are effective clunky.
Anyway, the game is crazy fun and I believe you all enjoy if you like platform style games of the genre.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027267313', 'num_games_owned': 1838, 'num_reviews': 4460, 'playtime_forever': 263, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 263, 'last_played': 1643041367}
review:
Tags: Platformer
Additional Tags: Delete Local Content & Remove from Library

TLDR: Small rage platformer with spikes and small margins for precision navigation. Gimmicky gun/flinger mechanic makes platforming and combat a chore.

This is a series of very short corridors. You have infinite lives and the levels are easily  bruteforced since progress is not reset. It reminded me a bit of Life Goes On for that reason. It also had that super meatboy oriented gameplay. With focus on dying. The boss fights in particular were annoying since you were given limited lives and ofen had to aim weapons at bosses while managing the fact that you are being flung around as a result. Often in line of fire of the boss or in spikes.

Conclusion: Altogether this has a nice tone and sets its levels nicely but the gimmicky core gameplay makes it just an inferior twist on momentum management with a finnicky lunar lander feel. Not really worth returning to past a few short giggle play sessions. If you really must play those small bite sized difficult levels. Then play 10 Second NinjaX which at least gives you solid controls and a slicker engine to do it in. Removed No Time to Explain Remastered permanently for declutter.
https://store.steampowered.com/app/435790/10_Second_Ninja_X/
https://store.steampowered.com/app/40800/Super_Meat_Boy/
https://store.steampowered.com/app/250050/Life_Goes_On_Done_to_Death/

author: {'steamid': '76561198061571355', 'num_games_owned': 292, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 895, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 890, 'last_played': 1601611545}
review:
After many attempts I have finally acquired the last achievement and can post my review!

I. Love. This. Game.

I (un?)fortunately didn't get to play it prior to the remastering, but I can say that I followed the game a little since its announcement on Kickstarter.  I loved the humor and the concept and am glad to say that it delivers on that front.

No Time to Explain is a short puzzle-platformer with a heavy splash of humor.  The puzzles don't become exceedingly hard, but they do challenge you to think differently as you progress from universe to universe.  Some puzzles require far more precision than others, but don't worry because in the event of failure you pick back up at your last known "okay position" (i.e. standing on solid ground).  This makes the game rather forgiving.

If you're looking for something humourous with a little puzzle and action sequences this game is for you.  If you're looking for a puzzle game with increasingly complex puzzles or for an action platformer you might want to pass this one up.

PS: My only gripe is that it took tinyBuild SO LONG to finally release the soundtrack for the Remastered Edition.  I've been using a bootleg version ripped from the Unity files for quite a while now, and am glad that I can purchase an official DLC with official names for tracks (as well as bonus tracks :D ).

author: {'steamid': '76561198054674251', 'num_games_owned': 660, 'num_reviews': 338, 'playtime_forever': 21, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 21, 'last_played': 1535458980}
review:
The controls are infuriating. You cannot even remap the jump to A. Albeit, the jump isn't super useful, but to have the reminder pop up everytime you reflexively press A to jump--like in any normal platforming game--is a pain. The game's main mode of platforming is the weapon you have. At first, it's an obvious reference to the old "imma firin ma lazar" meme from 15 years back, the second is a shotgun, and I only assume that each subsequent world delivers a new weapon-platformer. I don't know because I do not feel compelled in any way to continue playing.

The levels themselves, in the first two worlds I played, are uninspired. Spike-walled and plain. The first world at least changes the themes a bit, but the developers gave up on the second world, apparently "water" was enough.

Maybe this game was fun when it was released, but honestly, with the plethora of great platformers available, I wouldn't recommend buying this unless you're looking for a nostalgia kick.

review:
There were some fun levels in this game, but I felt they were far and few between. Most of the levels were frustrating, needing precision movement with imprecise controls. 

The humor also just didn't do it for me. I chuckled a few times, but found myself getting annoyed with the same few lines repeated over and over as I tried to finish a level. It's just not my brand of humor.

I certainly wouldn't pay full price for this game, but it was a halfway entertaining way to spend a couple hours.

author: {'steamid': '76561198002112565', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 282, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 282, 'last_played': 1534713683}
review:
I enjoyed this game actually but please read the review as to why i don't recommend it.

The game is just a basic puzzle game made in flash that takes around 2-2.5 hours to finish in shortest time span possible to finish it as a first time player.(rest depends on your level of expertise in puzzle genre).I am not good with them so it took me longer.

The game is simple.You have a beam laser you use to pass obstacles and enter wormholes to finish levels.Gameplay changes in certain chapters where you obtain different weapons and characters.Football players blast gun makes you fly in an arc trajectory,straitjacket flies opposite direction of your aim and acts like a slingshot,aborted fetus frog is the same as straitjacket except with the ability to sticks to the walls,Hipster beam has ink and shows invisible platforms and last one is a combination of regular beam and football players blast gun.

Levels are very forgiving and it starts you from the place you died.There are no lives and it makes the game feel lacking.
Difficulty curve is non-existent.Sometimes,first or second levels of the chapters are ridiculous and because the controls are clunky you just randomly try until you get to do it.Asylum level one is a good example of that.Perhaps thats why you have infinite lives and it is not enjoyable.

The music is ok,nothing noteworthy.It serves only as background noise.Story is non-existent and the humor is for manchildren that still roams NG.com and watches video game parodies.I did genuienly laugh at a few jokes.(mispronounced diabetes joke and the part where developers mock hipsters that think video games are art....I know...The manchildren infected me...)
Boss fights were quite fun actually and i enjoyed fighting them more than the rest of the game itself and that says something about the game.

VERDICT:I enjoyed this game and it's enjoyable for what it is meant to be.A short game to have fun but i think the gameplay is flawed and lacks substance for a game that I would buy.I just can't see myself buying this game for it's price.If thats what you are looking for i can recommend it otherwise do not buy this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198249747386', 'num_games_owned': 331, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 214, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 95, 'last_played': 1613359196}
review:
There's No Time To Explain Why, But Don't. Buy. This. Game.

Wait, yes, there is! But I need to be quick. The game is:
-Boring
-Repetitive
-Tedious
-There is an extreme variability in difficulty across the levels
-Poor controls
-It's more about your luck and patiently (stupidly?) repeating a level a dozen times until you finally hit the right spot to land on. Then rinse and repeat, on ugly, simple, repetitive and boring maps.
-Your whining future self gets boring pretty quickly at every respawn (like 10000 of them).
-You haven't even become comfortable with the mechanics when, without an explanation, a radically new one is introduced - only for it to disappear after a few levels. When the game is not the Most. Boring. Game. Ever., these unexplained, annoying surprises that make you wonder even more whether the devs are just messing with you, or flat out insane, are what keep you from falling into a come from boredom.

author: {'steamid': '76561198263594559', 'num_games_owned': 213, 'num_reviews': 72, 'playtime_forever': 178, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 138, 'last_played': 1576609761}
review:
No Time To Explain... Juego Indie de 2011, remasterizado para Steam, con gráficas mejores, y el extra de Workshop.
Pros:
Variedad extensa de obstáculos en tu travesía temporal.
Posibilidad de creación de niveles desde Workshop, como mencionado anteriormente.
Historia un tanto compleja, llena de viajes temporales, y vistas de tus yos alternos.
Dificultad razonable, un tanto dificil a veces.
Arte conceptual precioso para los lejanos 2011, regresando incluso mejor.
Variedad de sombreros desbloqueables muy extraños, desde gorros comunes, hasta cabezas de cualquier cosa.

Contras:
No he encontrado ninguno, es simplemente precioso.

Rating: 10/ 10  I AM YOU FROM THE FUTURE! There is no time to explain! Follow me into the- OH CHRIST!! AAAAH D:

author: {'steamid': '76561198009474997', 'num_games_owned': 2217, 'num_reviews': 1072, 'playtime_forever': 570, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 570, 'last_played': 1532453817}
review:
a Really fun and comedic game , you will really enjoy this one, but not at it's full price, it is over priced i think, this game isnt that long and really doesnt offer that much to make that price tag worth it in my opinion.

The game itself is quite enjoyable and even funny. It is a side scroller where you move from left to right to get through the campaign level, the game does get a bit harder as you reach higher levels but they are still doable.  The gameplay for this type of game is very decently done and you really do enjoy the game , unless this is not your type of game that is. The graphics arent that special but they were neatly done and implemented , fitting well with the game. The story may not be that deep but we have one and we follow it. The controls are fairly simple once you got used to them, its said that a controller is best for this game. All in all if you get this game in a bundle or on sale sure it is worth it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198054246483', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 137, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 137, 'last_played': 1529606889}
review: It's super fun for the first few levels but then instead of adding guns the developer decided to add all new mechanics that2 mae the game tedious to play. The boss fights also get progressively worse. Instead of making them more difficult the developer just made them last longer so it begins to feel like a chore to play. Long boss fights are fine but when the boss only does the same three moves the entire fight it's too much.

author: {'steamid': '76561198166645513', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 67, 'playtime_forever': 101, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 101, 'last_played': 1528468177}
review:
[h1][i]Pas le temps de faire un jeu remasterisé.[/i][/h1]

[i]Wah ! Ce jeu est génial ! Il a tellement d'humour à se prendre au second degré ! Quelle autodérision !"[/i] TA GUEULE. L'autodérision n'est pas une excuse pour faire un mauvais jeu.

Honnêtement, je n'ai apprécié le jeu que les dix premières minutes. Après c'est n'importe quoi. Le titre base toute sa justification sur le fait qu'il n'y a pas de justification. Cette idée aurait pu être la source d'un très bon titre, malheureusement c'est ce qu'on appelle dans le milieu... de la merde. Le jeu aurait clairement dû rester un jeu flash.

26k $ de budget. A l'échelle de l'économie vidéo-ludique, c'est très peu. Et pourtant, une quantité immense de développeurs ont fait bien mieux avec beaucoup moins. Comme quoi le manque de budget n'est pas une excuse non plus.

Bon, il est temps de passer au pourquoi de mon crachat salé sur ce jeu.

Tout d'abord, le prix. 15€. Pour un jeu flash remasterisé. Bon. Ensuite, le jeu est tout bonnement injouable. Apparemment les devs ont assez d'humour pour faire la blague de ne pas mettre un menu de paramètres. Navrant. Et dans la lignée du "rien n'est expliqué", AH BAH VOUS VOUS DOUTEZ BIEN, les mécaniques ne disposent même pas d'un tuto.
D'habitude je mettrais un screenshot en plein milieu de mon évaluation pour l'aérer un peu, mais dans le cas actuel cela ne ferait qu'augmenter le taux de malaise. Parce que oui, le jeu s'offre en plus le luxe d'être moche. Certes il aurait pu l'être encore plus, mais il l'est déjà bien. Et vous l'aurez au plus profond de vous deviné, j'en suis certain, ces graphismes dignes d'[i]E.T.[/i] sur Atari sont accompagnés d'une bande son d'une qualité exceptionnelle. [i]*Rires*[/i]. Si l'on considère qu'enregistrer des sons et les amplifier et les saturer c'est considéré comme de la création de bande sonore.

Ce qui m'ennuie dans tout ça, c'est que le jeu avait l'air bien. Je l'ai acheté (en soldes quand même, faut pas déconner) de bonne volonté, avec l'intention de passer un bon moment et de publier une évaluation positive. Eh bah en fait non. Je ne dirais pas que tout dans ce jeu est à jeter, mais en fait si.

Note : 8/20

author: {'steamid': '76561198105630917', 'num_games_owned': 625, 'num_reviews': 332, 'playtime_forever': 217, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 217, 'last_played': 1499485689}
review:
[quote=我不是魏赖皮]评测师招募中，你与评测师，只有一个叽咪的距离[url=https://jq.qq.com/?_wv=1027&k=5fHaxv2] 点击加入叽咪-评测走读班	[/url]
欢迎关注[url=https://steamcommunity.com/groups/GimmGimm#curation] 叽咪叽咪鉴赏家	[/url] [/quote]

什么！未来的我被杀啦？凶手是一只螃蟹！

什么！过去的我也被杀啦？凶手是一只白鲨！

什么！我也被杀啦？凶手是外星人！

等等，不同时段的我都死了，那“我”是谁→_→

没时间解释了，马上就出发！拯救自己大冒险开始啦。

该作让我形容大概就是一款休闲虐心小游戏，画风卡通，操作“简单”。从某种程度上来说确实算简单，毕竟玩家只能左右移动和射，但是难就难在这个射上。游戏是没有跳跃的，而且前路坎坷，全是刺儿和坑，你能凭借的只有手里的喷枪。喷枪怎么移动呢？靠牛顿。

根据牛顿第三定律，两个物体之间的作用力和反作用力，在同一条直线上，大小相等，方向相反。那么可以各位玩家应该明白了，咱们就靠喷枪反向推力进行移动。

初体验是比较难适应的，后来习惯了惯性啊，反冲力啊这些你就会爱上牛顿。研究出了这么有哲理的定律，丰富了这款游戏。

游戏是大小关制的。一个大关由有若干个小关组成，每个关卡的机制都不同。

比如枪械由持续输出的喷枪变为爆炸效果的炸枪，你就需要习惯新的牛顿(误);

比如吃蛋糕后人物会变成肥子，然后可以通过惯性撞掉一些砖块继续前进等等。

反正这个游戏核心玩法离不开牛顿，我想作者可能是个彻头彻尾的理科生叭。

最后聊聊收集元素。游戏每个大关都藏了很多帽子供玩家收集，有些是你目之所及，但非常难拿到；有些则藏的很深，需要开一些脑洞。反正我不看全收集攻略，是绝对找不到那些东西的。(有贴吧老哥出了攻略，太感谢他！)

总的来说这款游戏休闲有余，深究不足。但作为一个非硬核向的普通玩家来说这个难度也够各位喝上一壶的。笔者因翻滚关过不去而弃坑，可以说是毫无毅力了，给自己一个耳刮子。

玩感不错，趣味性尚可，喜欢此类游戏推荐折后入手。

author: {'steamid': '76561198343248985', 'num_games_owned': 113, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 287, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 264, 'last_played': 1528458645}
review:
原本只想找个夕阳红游戏打发时间，结果发现这游戏非常不适合养老...

成就获取有点困难，不看攻略到目前也只拿到了一个成就（[i]Haters gonna hate[/i]）。

[strike] 本着夕阳红操作来玩，某种程度上游戏体验极差，游戏后半段对于我这种不怎么玩硬核游戏的人非常不友好。昼篇花了两小时结束，夜篇打了快一个半小时也没见到BOSS，弹来弹去不好控制，一个小节就要死十几次。操作的容错率非常小，动不动就得重来。虽然游戏的存档点设定得很棒，不用死了就得从头开始，而是在附近直接复活。但有些地方就是，拼了命也过不去。[/strike]

如果抱着玩硬核游戏的心态来玩的话，应该会觉得比较轻松。背景音乐和音效都非常棒，但是死太多次听了反而会腻。这游戏更适合给主播做实况而不是个人打发时间。

整体剧情有点都合主义的感觉，昼篇勉强能看懂剧情，进入夜篇剧情有些奇怪，还没通关，不过已经被虐得心态崩了，先让我卸载游戏冷静冷静。

一款非常棒的游戏。

不适合养老。

==================================

A Fantastic game with excellent gamer experience

author: {'steamid': '76561197999383250', 'num_games_owned': 1589, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 299, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 299, 'last_played': 1526294462}
review:
[quote]
Wenn dir das Review gefallen hat und du weitere tolle Spiele entdecken willst, dann schau dir doch mal [url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/35814574/]meine Kuratorenseite[/url]  an. Ein Follow würde mich sehr freuen
[/quote]

No time to Explain verbindet abgefahren Humor mit kreativen Gamedesign und entfacht einen Spielfluss der ähnlich wie bei Super Meatboy ist. Noch ein Versuch, ein Level noch und im Endeffekt werden es immer mehr. Die Grundidee ist, dass der Rückstoß der Waffe dein hauptool zur Fortbewegung ist jedoch verändern sich die Mechaniken im Spielverlauf immer wieder, wodurch für ausreichend Abwechslung gesorgt wird.

Das volle Review ist auf Youtube:
https://youtu.be/92JIccvoxv4

author: {'steamid': '76561198019315410', 'num_games_owned': 631, 'num_reviews': 73, 'playtime_forever': 128, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 128, 'last_played': 1527313450}
review:
My friends don't like platformers as much, which is a shame because I personally really enjoyed this. It's entirely puzzle platforming, stuff like "how do I get myself over there" instead of "oh no dodge lasers and return fire." The game lives up to its name, there really is no time to explain. New mechanics are introduced wordlessly, explained only through clever level design that encourages the player to discover what they can do with the new mechanic, and flawlessly tests the player's knowledge later for just long enough to stay fun. Cosmetic collectables litter the levels to provide an optional challenge that usually requires total mastery of the new mechanic. The hats range from amazing to meh, and I'm personally not a fan of the ones that replace your head entirely, but they're all fun to acquire and enjoy having in your collection, even if you never use them.

Don't be like me and forget about this game for a year or else you'll forget core mechanics like [spoiler]you get more height by walking off an edge while shooting down instead of jumping first.[/spoiler]

author: {'steamid': '76561198138337568', 'num_games_owned': 110, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 32, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 32, 'last_played': 1508469259}
review:
At first I had high hopes for this game seeing how it had decent humour and interesting game mechanics but after about 20-30 minutes it just gts repetitive and boring, feeling like the developers just kinda streched out the game for more play time. Eben though I got the game for free I just see no interest in playing it. If you wanna buy it Buy it on a big sale so you dont have to spend the 17 D O L L A R S for a flash game thats not even fun. 

   In expection to this the developers (TinyBuild) Have made some other, very fun games like Speedrunners, Punch Club, and Hello Neighbour so if you like to support the developers you can get those games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198287098454', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 193, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 193, 'last_played': 1520210542}
review:
El precio estaba a punto de mandarme a no recomendarlo; pero, sería hipócrita de mi parte pues lo recibí gratis. 

Las diferentes mecánicas son entretenidas y el concepto en sí me parece muy divertido. Todo el rollo de que no hay tiempo de explicar nada de lo que está pasando me parece una genial manera de plantear los escenarios más ridículos sin tomarse la molestia de si quiera pensar en la lógica detrás de ellos. 

Es una experiencia bacán, pero lo del precio es fastidioso. El contenido no es suficiente para lo que cuesta. La cantidad de niveles y escenarios son bastante cortos y reducidos. Si no me he pasado el juego en 5 horas es porque soy noob. 

Lo recomiendo en oferta de no menos del 80%

review: This is a very satisfying fast-paced platformer with tight controls and a great sense of humour. A must-play for fans of time-travel lore.

author: {'steamid': '76561198022389601', 'num_games_owned': 677, 'num_reviews': 274, 'playtime_forever': 24752, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 638, 'last_played': 1572491568}
review:
é hilário, foda, engraçado e uma aventura 2D bem esteriotipada de tudo que eu já joguei.
O game se ambientaliza com você voltando do futuro de outras realidades virtuais em um mundo já caótico e destruído, e ao mesmo tempo você tenta ir avançando na história por inúmeros mundos aleatórios para tentar completar o jogo.

Gostei da mecânica fast do game, sem falar das gritarias que o proprio personagem dá de forma insana.

author: {'steamid': '76561198093919303', 'num_games_owned': 278, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 158, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 158, 'last_played': 1519002213}
review:
What a cute little indie game. With many indie games, there's this need to feel like it's contributing something novel to gaming in general. I don't get that feel with No Time To Explain. Instead, it's just a quirky platformer that, admittedly, feels like a revamped online game (which is probably appropriate, since it is.) It took me two hours to complete, though there were many hats that I could have found in the various worlds; I probably found 50% of them.

Let's start off with the mechanics. This is both the best and most frustrating part of the game: your character moves extremely slowly and your jump is quite frankly pathetic, but the LASER CANNON more than makes up for the both of them. The only issue on that front is that the cannon is fairly hard to control. I played this game with a gamepad, and I feel like that was probably the right choice. A keyboard would just be weird, and probably even worse control-wise.

Next up is story. The story of this game is extremely chaotic, up till and including the reveal of the main villain. The main character changes multiple times, and your movement options change as well. There was a level that just felt shoehorned in because the devs thought it was a good idea. Granted, it was, but it did feel slightly out of place.

The soundtrack was appropriate. Different boss and world music that didn't get too repetitive, and faded into the background nicely. If anything, it highlighted the "online game"  aspect just due to its somewhat basic electronic groove that we all know from games like super meat boy, electronic super joy, etc.

Finally the art. Not great, not bad either. Again, a very blatant reminder of the whole online game thing, with insane explosions and blood loss.

Ultimately, it was good, but not fantastic. When I looked back at the actual price/what I payed for it, I was slightly shocked; No Time To Explain is, in my opinion, very definitely overpriced at $15. At 50% off, it's still a bit too much, but there's a decent chance that I'm just saying that because I'm pretty cheap. Go ahead and buy it if you like interesting platformers, or if you have any nostalgia for those early 2000's online platformers.

review: Well then I'll actually explain it to you: You have a crazy powerful laser weapon that pushes you the opposite direction when you fire.  Then...well, lots of stuff happens, involving you from the future...and it just kind of picks up from there.

author: {'steamid': '76561198011987255', 'num_games_owned': 264, 'num_reviews': 67, 'playtime_forever': 74, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 20, 'last_played': 1525929396}
review:
For a flash game redone in Unity, it's not bad. The humor wears off quickly but the gameplay is solid. Levels quickly get more challening till you finally reach the "hard-core" platformer level. The only thing I dislike is how boss fights have limited lives, whereas the rest of the game you simply respawn at the last point where you landed safely. It makes boss fights unnecessarily frustrating.

For the price though, and what it is, you can't go wrong here.

author: {'steamid': '76561198017350811', 'num_games_owned': 1755, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 589, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 589, 'last_played': 1517512490}
review:
Jak najbardziej polecam !!!
Przyjemna platformówka, zabawna i przemyślana,
Na pierwszy rzut oka od razu bawi, ale wydaje się że panuje w niej chaos, a wcale tak nie jest!
Dynamiczna gra, bo przecież NIE MA CZASU NA WYJAŚNIENIA !!! XD
Przejście całej gry nie zajmuje dużo czasu (3h), ale daje satysfakcję.
Achiwmenty do zdobycia dla tych co lubią się pomęczyć i jak najlepiej rozpracować grę. 
Fabuły nie ma co zdradzać, bo tylko zepsuje to zaskoczenie, którym obdarowywuje gra.
Gra pod koniec zaskakuje (pozytywnie), polecam .

author: {'steamid': '76561198196342970', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 247, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 82, 'last_played': 1547072839}
review:
如果有手柄的话建议和朋友一起，他用键盘你用手柄，玩的时候开心就好

这个游戏有并不益智的解密（主要是寻找解题思路和隐藏道路）和跑酷两个元素
保持心态平和

关于游戏的一些机制：
物理枪相当于一个大的跳，能跳多高是固定的，激光只是一个特效
大多数工具都必须要站稳之后才能再次使用（物理枪在空中只能调整方向，仅此而已，别太指望它）
boss的技能是有前摇的，而且很长，所以不要放弃，去找规律

[spoiler] 还有，这破游戏某宝1块多一个key，别买贵了	[/spoiler]

author: {'steamid': '76561198299249599', 'num_games_owned': 742, 'num_reviews': 385, 'playtime_forever': 226, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 226, 'last_played': 1515679463}
review:
剧情
未来的自己来救我被杀了，过去的自己来救我又被杀了，平行世界里面就靠我了！最后我去把怪物全杀了！
总结：6.5/10
通关比较简单大概2小时不到，有个别Boss卡了比较久
整体来说无论画面，手感，音乐都还不错
适合无聊的时候打发时间玩玩

author: {'steamid': '76561198090438425', 'num_games_owned': 276, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 164, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 164, 'last_played': 1515662966}
review:
Stiff controls. After few stages, repetative level design only with different mechanics. I know this game was not made in a huge studio and a lot of people using a big budget, but I know some cheaper games than this one that have better voice acting, better sound quality and better visuals. Some bosses are way to easy, some bosses are unreasonably hard. Last boss is horribly done. There are a bunch of exploits in the game that devs weren't thinking about. Not worth the money at all.

SPOILERS:
The only thing I found amusing is the ink levels where the pixelated guy tells you reasons why games are art. You need to find platforms using black ink instead of the laser, neat idea.

Non consiglio l'acquisto a meno che non cerchiate una di quelle sfide dove bisogna fare i salti, alle volte, al millimetro. Per me questo non è sinonimo di divertimento.

author: {'steamid': '76561198143496972', 'num_games_owned': 341, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 718, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 681, 'last_played': 1638697143}
review:
第一个见到的未来的自己，在见面4-5秒后被一个螃蟹抓走了
第一个见到的过去的自己，在见面4-5秒后被我喂鲨鱼了
掉落地底世界，误放出了来自邪恶未来的自己
甜食世界，将自己吃成个胖子，以肉躯撞开球机器的盖子
胃世界，打一下变刺的砖，物理护盾能站人
喂我明明想的是二段跳，为什么让我和橄榄球选手合体啊mmp
闯入城堡，与邪恶的自己最终决战，机智的火焰护盾不要用脸接
败的较惨，回到过去，邪恶的自己在双杀后被螃蟹抓走了，YOU WIN

通关不易，全收集很难，成就(看不懂)难上加难
剧情不错，但对手残真的不友好，了解剧情可以看实况
创意工坊很多很棒的图可以玩，受苦不仅局限在通关前
网上攻略提到的最难拿的帽子不吃蛋糕先碰蛋糕上面的翻转，迅速把自己喷到卷里，碰翻转，这就是上下反转了，接下来就容易多了
虽然不用中文也能懂剧情，但成就真的看不懂啊qwq

author: {'steamid': '76561198135528601', 'num_games_owned': 136, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 2783, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 864, 'last_played': 1611849867}
review:
Quote "Physics, nuff' said" ~Myself. <- TL:DR


      Well, physics are one of the funnest game mechanics, trying to strategize while adjusting to a new mechanic of momentum makes exploring extremely fun. My only problem is that the level size is fairly small even though giant mega levels COULD be made. I feel like less levels that are bigger > a lot of short levels.
      
      Also the steedrun achievment is a little bit too difficult imo.

author: {'steamid': '76561198156713739', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 166, 'playtime_forever': 234, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 234, 'last_played': 1513695266}
review:
I AM YOU FROM THE FUTURE!!! Это просто щиииидевр! Купив бандл за 1 доллар, я как-то пропустил мимо это игру, но начав играть, уже просто не можешь остановиться! Игра не отпускает тебя до самого конца: тут вам и интересные уровни, и классные боссы, и забавные персонажи, а также много различных игровых механик. Вам не дадут заскучать, так как только вам покажеться, что становиться скучно, резко меняется и мир, и стиль игры, в общем, игру нельзя пропускать!)))
 Однозначно рекомендую, а как только вы зайдете в мастерскую... Вы там надолго потеряетесь :D
 I AM YOU FROM THE FUTURE!!! MUST HAVE! Также, если вам она понравится, очень рекомендую Battleblock Theater ( это лучшая игра со времен марио, еще и на двоих ) и speedrunners ( но в нее нужно играть вчетвером )

author: {'steamid': '76561198322966598', 'num_games_owned': 19, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 4543, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2264, 'last_played': 1526161610}
review: Este jogo é muito massa, já joguei há anos, eu recomendo comprar isso que você não vai se arrepender! Vem com vários níveis, chapéus, chefões, personagens para se jogar e muita coisa pra se fazer.

author: {'steamid': '76561198198006519', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 282, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 282, 'last_played': 1513498582}
review:
Interessanter Platformer mit manchmal merkwürdiger aber dennoch innovativer Fortbewegung. Die Steuerung klappt mit einem Gamepad vermutlich besser als mit Tastatur und Maus. Mit Maus verschwand gerne das Fadenkreuz am Bildrand und ich musste mich neu orientieren. Auflösung ist 720p. Nur als Info für alle, die mindestens 1080p erwarten. Das spielt aber letztlich keine Rolle. Die Grafik ist hübsch anzusehen und es gibt eine lustige Story mit vielen Gags. Die Musik ist abwechselungsreich, angenehm und passend. Das Spiel ist sehr liebevoll gemacht und empfehlenswert es mal zu spielen. Nur 6 Prozent aller Besitzer des Spiels haben es durchgespielt. Na, das kann ja so nicht bleiben. ^^

Spielzeit liegt je nach Können bei 2-6h. Wobei man auch gerne ab und zu steckenbleiben kann und erstmal einen "Lösungsweg" finden muss.

author: {'steamid': '76561198064354254', 'num_games_owned': 280, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 153, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 153, 'last_played': 1513208828}
review: No Time To Explain is a very random and fun indie game about time traveling and laserbeams. I would say it's worth the money even at full price, but keep in mind that the game isn't that long. It focuses on fun gameplay and story, and it succeeds well with this goal. It isn't the best game I've played for it's price tag though, so wait for sale if you're unsure.

author: {'steamid': '76561198071291943', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 25, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 25, 'last_played': 1512904498}
review: For me it's simple - platformer where you are using weapon recoil to beat levels. I'm not kinda person who likes spend much time in these type of games, where I need to try and try to beat some point trying to master a sequence on some level. I'm still recommending this game as this is something for people who like platformer with non-linear approach for beating the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198083994096', 'num_games_owned': 1271, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 59, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 59, 'last_played': 1512226168}
review:
Well, seem most of the people around here likes the game, and I have hard time understanding why.

The game is hard, but it is so, not because it is actually hard but because the controls are insane and level desing expects you to be "hair precise". And when you are not you die. That is one of the things thing I actually hate here. But that is not enough, when you die, you just respawn. Or you go one "step" back and respawn there, when a "boss" is involved. That is another thing I really hate. Should not this game be hard? Or did I missed something? This looks more like "master the control so precisely so you can finish the level while blind and with only our off-hand". That is another (and)  a bit worse verison of what I stated earlier that I hate. Also, it tries to be funny, but when I see or hear the same joke over and over again, while I am trying to learn to control the game, it just gets boring, and in fact, even though it was ment to be funny and maybe sometimes even was few first times, it gets anoying realy realy soon and in the end it makes things even worse.

So, I unerstand, that some people are in it for the challenge of beating something impossible or whatever, even though I do not really undertand why, but if you are that kind of person, just treat this a positive review. But for me it feels like a total waste of time. And yes. I know I am speaking about time waster here.

So, in the end, I think this really is not a game for me, and if I didn't get it as part of some low cost bundle somewhere, I would be requesting refund right away, because the price really does seems insane to me more than the controlls

author: {'steamid': '76561198278697384', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 350, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 350, 'last_played': 1511951582}
review:
Videojuego de plataformas con cierto parecido a los antiguos del género pero aprovechando la versatilidad de tener un ratón en la mano para ofrecer una propuesta algo diferente.

El apartado gráfico no es la gran cosa pero cumple para ser un juego de este género, además de hacer los enfrentamientos finales algo más desenfadados.

La duración es bastante corta además de que en cuanto a rejugabilidad yo no le doy demasiadas esperanzas, pues he completado el juego y conseguido todos los coleccionables en unas cuatro horas, además de completar algunos logros por mero gusto lo que solo ha subido una hora de duración al título. En cinco horas ya he visto todo lo que ofrece y he rejugado muchos niveles, además de haberme quedado con la impresión de que no lo voy a volver a tocar por esto mismo, así que estamos hablando de un juego realmente corto.

Hay que hablar también de la campaña, pues ha dejado la historia de lado para directamente meternos en la aventura sin preocuparnos por absolutamente nada más, mientras vamos avanzado vemos que realmente sí que hay una trama, pero como los mismo creadores del juego sabían, es una mierda y no tiene relevancia alguna, así que la única función es tener una excusa para hacernos recorrer los diferentes niveles por los que vamos pasando. Al menos los toques de humor son algo que le da cierta simpatía a lo poco de trama que vamos viendo al avanzar.

Recomiendo probar el juego pues realmente es muy entretenido, eso sí, no merece lo que vale pues es demasiado corto, pero si lo consiguen como parte de un Bundle es una compra asegurada.

author: {'steamid': '76561198032632033', 'num_games_owned': 247, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 97, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 97, 'last_played': 1511703353}
review:
No Time To Explain ist definitiv witzig, obwohl der Schwierigkeitsgrad nicht immer zum Lachen war. 

Ab einer bestimmten Stelle wird eine neue "Mechanik" eingeführt, welche den Spielfluss - zumindest für mich - fast ganz zum Erliegen gebracht hat.

Wer jedoch Freude an schweren 2D-Platformern hat und auch mit dem Humor von No Time To Explain etwas anfangen kann, sollte dem Spiel unbedingt eine Chance geben. Zumal man bei dem Preis (zurzeit 3,74€) fast nichts falsch machen kann.

Wertung: 7/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198243477348', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 57, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 57, 'last_played': 1512187983}
review:
Do not play this game. This game is a failed attempt at a humorous and challenging platformer. allow me to explain, I have time:
1. The art and sound- this game simply looks like a newgrounds cartoon. which is acceptable for a video, (as that kind of animation does require a lot of effort) but in a game like this each character only really needs max 30 different frames of animation, so the characters just look incredibly lazy. throw into the mix that just about every part of the backgrounds and levels are just as simple, the end game just looks very bare bones, which would be acceptable under other cirmustances, e.g. undertale is a very charming game with a simple art style, however the character and background design in No Time To Explain is not nearly as charming. it just looks like a 2-minute youtube short. the musical score is very repeditive and forgetable and the sound of the primary lazer weapon sounds like my speakers are dying.

2. "Humor"- as previously mentioned, this game looks like a youtube short made by ameteur animators, and writing matches quite well. all of the humor in this game thus far has just been a character constantly shouting in pain as they are being eaten by some kind of monster. this becomes even more annoying when you constantly die, causing you to listen to the SAME ANNOYING LINES OVER AND OVER! the voice acting itself is very reminscent of some talentless and cringy letsplayer putting on voices.

3. gameplay- i'll admit i haven't played much of this, (i tried but i just hated it so much i couldnt continue) but from what ive experienced so far, the entire game is just plaforming and boss fights. (i dont even think there are non boss enemies in this) the platforming is much like that of super meat boy. the gimmick however, is that your player-character cannot jump more than like, 2 pixels on screen, so you have to rocket around with a variety of weapons, primarily a laser cannon. the physics of the character and the gun are way too fast and the controls are much too floaty, making the game a lot more frustrating than challenging. The boss fights take away the one saving grace from the plaforming because now- instead of infinite lives- you have three. and the problem is that 90% of player death can be put down to the characters own weapon, which incidentally seems to do pretty much no damage to the enemy, because its putting all of its effort into pushing you into spikes everytime you shoot it. 

I got this game in humble bundle with speedrunners. speedrunners is actually good. get that instead.

author: {'steamid': '76561198380117916', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 561, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 371, 'last_played': 1699832898}

review:
这游戏从一开始就带着强烈的恶搞精神。
游戏宣传片开嗓就是“我是来自未来的你”，本以为是一个回到过去时间线拯救世界的故事，结果帅不过三秒出门嗝屁。
游戏充满了各种恶趣味，小品级游戏，逗得开心就好。

review:
Wer auf schwere Plattformer steht, sollte sich No Time To Explain Remastered einmal anschauen.

Zwar ist die Grafik nicht wirklich gut und die Steuerung ein Tick zu ungenau, aber durch die neue Sprungmechanik und die meist fairen Rücksetzpunkte hat mich das Spiel bis zum letzten Level bei Laune gehalten.

3/5

author: {'steamid': '76561198093777640', 'num_games_owned': 631, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 347, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 347, 'last_played': 1507631768}
review:
玩了两三个小时才发现这游戏尼玛键盘WASD键可以操控方向的，我前三个小时纯鼠标玩的（MMP），游戏难度到后面都很大，反人类的鼠标操纵方式才是最蛋疼的特别是不用键盘的时候，这游戏简直手残党的噩梦，建议喜加一挂卡，手残党们听我一句[spoiler] 为了你们的鼠标键盘着想，最好别尝试这游戏 = =、	[/spoiler]  当然，如果喜欢玩游戏自虐的玩家推荐可以尝试玩玩
PS：不知道有没有人和我一样玩到BOSS是土拨鼠那关就过不去了，反正我这关是打了两个小时了，最长一次是打了半个小时没死，我没死BOSS也没死，不知道是BUG还是那BOSS就是血究极厚的用来恶心人的关卡BOSS= =

最后，手残党千万千万别买！[spoiler] 会哭的！[/spoiler]

review: Простенькая, но в то же время жутко доставляющая игра. Сюжет примитивный и немного наркоманский, временами(по началу постоянно) заставляет воскликнуть: "да что тут вообще происходит?!". После прохождения открывается куча дополнительных миссий  + почти все ачивки - это отдельные челленджи (вида "пройти уровень на время определённым персонажем").

author: {'steamid': '76561198080319088', 'num_games_owned': 564, 'num_reviews': 59, 'playtime_forever': 73, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 73, 'last_played': 1505737293}
review:
I bought the game, because it was so highly advertised during the GDQ's and I expected a high quality game for a high quality event. Unfortunately it was just like any other indie game.

The Commentary and Humour is extremely forced and immature. It seems like they wanted to say ''Fukc'' as often as possible, just for the sake of saying it and 'being funny'.  But thats just like my opinion, man, so no deduction for the humour.

The gameplay itself is just bland and boring. You're waiting for the game to get started, but it keeps intoducing gameplay and new characters, so you never really get to a point where you can enjoy it. It much moreso seems like a demo, full of ''look what i managed to programm''-stuff from the devs, packed into one game, hold together by ducttape.
That CAN work, see Cuphead, and in this case it clearly didn't, one example for that :
The controls aren´t tight enough for a touhou section. (You're flying with a JetPack and get into a bullethell-esk Level)
And if you die, guess what, you have to play the whole level again, which can be up to 4 minutes long + watch the cringy unskipable intro every time.
Thats another huge downside : Unskipable intros. I mean, even if you enjoy the humour you must agree that the cutscenes are annoying if you have to watch them several times.

And my last complaint : It is absolutly overpriced. I don't remember where I got the game from, but I'm a 100% sure that I didn't spend 15$ on this. You can buy Skyrim, 15 bundles, a humble bundle monthly with 3+ top tier games  or anything else in the same price range and you'll be happier with that than with this. I garuantee.

author: {'steamid': '76561198271433195', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 60, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 60, 'last_played': 1499625883}
review: TinyBuild seemed to be scraping at the bottom of the barrel with this game. It rapidly declined in the entertainment derived from it as it slowly progressed toward tediousness. There is a line drawn between a challenge and a long-drawn story and this game simply crossed the line.

author: {'steamid': '76561198365825831', 'num_games_owned': 2784, 'num_reviews': 339, 'playtime_forever': 474, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 185, 'last_played': 1580743756}
review:
미래의 내가 나타나서 "설명할 시간이 없어!"라고 말하고는 바로 집게한테 잡혀가는 환상적인 이야기입니다. 주인공은 미래의 나를 쫓아 미래와 과거를 오가면서 장애믈을 피해나가죠. 그러다 또 다른 미래의 나한테 차에 치어서 죽기도하고;; 
전체적으로 유머가 가득하고 스피디한 재미를 느낄수 있습니다. 로컬멀티 플레이어를 하면 둘 중에 한명만 통과하면 되는데 못 하는 사람이 트롤을 하기 시작하면 아무도 못깹니다. ㅋㅋㅋ

author: {'steamid': '76561198192921823', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 354, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 281, 'last_played': 1694262657}
review:
«НЕТ ВРЕМЯНИ ОБЪЯСНЯТЬ» наглядный пример сложной, разнообразной, и невероятно странной (в хорошем смысле) игры. Она, объединяет в себе несколько вещей, которые вам могут понравится, от врывающихся, как, тапок в моё окно, крабов, до путешествий во времени и джетпака (правда на нём можно полетать только один раз, но всё же он есть). Так же в сюжете большое количество wtf моментов, которые заставляют вас не вольно улыбнутся и благодаря им создаётся впечатление лёгкой и забавной игры, которая вам поможет скоротать вечерок, другой.
В целом сюжет можно пройти за 4 часа и + 2 доп. уровня. Может этого покажется вам мало и возможно вы правы, но лично мне этого хватило.
Если подводить итоги, то этой игре можно поставить 8.9 летающих тапков/ 10 крабов.
Почему не 10/10? Потому что, слабый (каким бы он не был забавным) сюжет (хотя для такой игры это не самая важная составляющая, но всё же без него никуда). Не вероятно странные (в плохом смысле слова титры). И ещё всё таки маленькое количество уровней, что следовательно влияет на время за которое вы пройдёте сюжет (повторюсь, для меня это не является большим минусом, но всё же я пишу этот обзор не для себя, а для других и для большинства это большой минус). Это всё, что мне не понравилось в этой игре. А так, она шикарна.
Я думаю, если вы надумали покупать эту игру, то лучшим решением будет дождаться скидок. Потому что в общей сложности примерно 6 часов геймплея это всё равно чертовски мало.
P.s во время запуска игры берегите уши.

author: {'steamid': '76561197982490998', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 487, 'playtime_forever': 165, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 165, 'last_played': 1505510629}
review:
Ce jeu, c'est portnawak! Et le prix aussi! 15€ Clairement, passez votre route. Je vous recommande ce jeu uniquement parce que vous pouvez le trouver en fouillant un peu pour moins de 2€. Là il vaut le coup.
C'est du die&retry... mais c'est drole. C'est parfois frustrant... mais c'est drole. Vous allez mourrir très souvent... mais vous allez le faire avec le sourire. ;)

C'est un très bon petit jeu, avec des graphismes pas très beaux, mais réussis. Les bruitages et l'histoire sont vraiment marrants. Bref, un jeu a prendre au second degré.

author: {'steamid': '76561198106199923', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 141, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 141, 'last_played': 1461967691}
review: No Time to Explain is a sidescrolling platformer/shooter concerning time paradoxes and giant laser guns in an easily digestable, even humorous game. The reveal of new mechanics and their relation to the story are paced really well and i was able to beat the game in a matter of a few hours. It presents its ideas organically and explicity. Overall, this game is great and well worth its cost.

author: {'steamid': '76561198063841980', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 343, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 343, 'last_played': 1504861034}
review:
My GOD I hate this game.

To keep it short and sweet:

[b]Pros:[/b]
[list]
    [*]The humor is good, for the most part. I laughed at a few of the jokes, which is more than most games can offer.
    [*]The music has its moments, but for the most part it's passable at best.
[/list]

[b]Cons:[/b]
[list]
    [*]The platforming gimmick isn't fun, it's frustrating. You never feel like you're really in control of your character, sometimes you can do what seems to be the exact same movement but get wildly different results.
    [*]The art is bland. Most of the tilesets are basic and the world feels flat. Some assets [spoiler] The gravity spin tiles in the candy world[/spoiler] feel out of place.
    [*]The level design is boring and the difficulty curve is like a rollercoaster. Most of the time, levels felt like a jumble of objects instead of a 'real' place, for lack of a better word.
[/list]

Overall, this game is mediocre/below average. I wouldn't suggest it, sale or not.

author: {'steamid': '76561198104310900', 'num_games_owned': 345, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 294, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 211, 'last_played': 1536274710}

author: {'steamid': '76561198353130969', 'num_games_owned': 207, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 726, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 658, 'last_played': 1687418399}
review:
I Am You From The Future! No Time To Explain, Follow m-OH CHRIST!
没时间解释了，快上车！
来自未来的你刚要拉你，便被怪物拖走了，而你获得了未来的你的激光枪。
简易的画风，滑稽的背景乐，诙谐幽默的故事，构成了《No Time To Explain Remastered》这样富有tinyBuild特点的喜剧游戏。
这是关于时间悖论的游戏，在对抗BOSS和收集帽子的同时，追逐未来的自我，穿越时间。你可以用强力的未来大炮和激光枪做武器，攻击敌人亦或靠反作用力跨越地形。这是一种非常新颖的思路。
流程较短，我11H通关并获得了大部分帽子（唯一没拿到的是吃货世界第四关高台上的一个帽子，要左冲上高台右冲上高台，到最高点拿帽子，比较难吧）。关卡式，可以在空闲时随意打上几关。

author: {'steamid': '76561198047569822', 'num_games_owned': 464, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 261, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 261, 'last_played': 1496348248}
review: Remember when you played platform games as a kid and messed around with the controls to do weird things to make the character jump higher? This game is all about that feeling. Difficult as heck, but with the very quick respawns, this becomes a short, enjoyable game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197992056243', 'num_games_owned': 1204, 'num_reviews': 72, 'playtime_forever': 140, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 140, 'last_played': 1504364822}
review:
Here's my review so far with 2.5 Hours. This game is hilarious. I love the voice and dialogue within this game. However, this game is HARD. Not sure how I'm going to get passed the stage I'm at. Great with gamepad, runs smooth, decent graphics/art. Haven't got a single Achievement yet, there's 9 of them. All in all, I recommend this game for anyone looking for something challenging and different.

Also about other people's reviews, $16.99 is a bit steep for sure. Didn't realize this was originally a Flash Game, and like them I too got it from Humble Bundle. Still a good game. Some levels you're going to play over and over, but you learn some tricks and the do's and dont's. So to the one guy saying very poor mechanics and controls, I beg to differ. You just didn't understand how to use it and work with it, and how each level is meant to be beat.
