review:
It's a reverse jetpack mechanic, in that you shoot a gun and move the oposite way. On some platforming levels, if you keep it fixed and aimed at the right angle you've got yourself a flappy bird game.
I tried both controller and mouse but found this game frustrating and gave up, but some people may like it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197969749884', 'num_games_owned': 2459, 'num_reviews': 1422, 'playtime_forever': 2526, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2526, 'last_played': 1503728292}
review:
No Time To Explain is the remake of a free browser flash game based on attraction as well as repulsion physics to make it through the corresponding levels. It is really minimalistic in gameplay terms, although it features half a dozen different worlds with just as many different specials versions of the physics gun you're using to make it out alive.

The art design fits the game and at times it feels like south park on steroids. Which is a good thing in my book.

All in all, it's a nice little gem for doing some missions inbetween. It's definitely not worth the asking price though and should only be picked up as part of a bundle or on sale.

review: I really wanted to like this game, It looked fun and funny and challenging. I played through the entire first section of the game which for the most part I enjoyed. I am not just complaning because the game was too hard to beat. Ther is a diference between challenging and teadious. half of the time you rely on luck more than skill to pass levels and that is not fun for me. I played dark souls, i know hard diffuculties but this was just painful. I wanted to like this game so much but it fell so short.

author: {'steamid': '76561198010155821', 'num_games_owned': 791, 'num_reviews': 100, 'playtime_forever': 430, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 430, 'last_played': 1501454157}
review:
[h1] What the f*** ?? [/h1]

Those words precise crossed my mind as I watched gigantic crab, holding a guy spraying blood over half the screen, run away from another person flying on a laser beam fired from a gun. That was barely a developer introduction panel. It sets the tone for the rest of the game perfectly as it is full of ridicullous and absurd humour. If you enjoyed levels of absurd present in Kung Fury or ASDF movies you should probably find yourself at home with this game.

[b] Time To Explain [/b]
As the game progresses what seemed nothing less than a silly gimmick at the first glance gradually truns out to be fairly solid platformer. Once I started focusing more on game mechanics I enjoyed the variety perhaps not so much in the level desing as in means of completing it. Primary mechanic is flying on a laser beam but game continues to add new elements (such as shotgun leaping and a sidescroller shooter sequence) at a pace sufficent for game to stay fresh and interesting throughout its course.

The game is rather short but completion time as with every platformer varies greatly on individual skill. No Time To Explain doesn't require masochistic joys of e.g. Super Meat Boy for its completion. Hardcore platformer enthusiast should try complete achievements, with extra conditions they apply, game can be quite a challenge. Alluring feature for some might be the local co-op which can turn the game into a "couch" title to play with your firends. Also No Time To Explain includes level editor with full workshop support which can increase game's lifespan greatly.

This title definitely isn't for everyone but it can make for a good laugh and enjoyable if a little cranky platformer.

author: {'steamid': '76561198110856032', 'num_games_owned': 400, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 428, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 403, 'last_played': 1588084979}
review: Although "Remastered" is in the title, it still looks like a resized flash game from Newgrounds. But, [b]BUT[/b], it's witty, it's fast-paced, and an all-around good time. You're bounced around between multiple wacky, alternate universes to play as different you's and collect different hats. And if you want a goddamn challenge, then try to earn all of the Steam achievements. Those last few were some of the most difficult, rage-inducing achieves I've ever earned, and dammitall, I earned them.

author: {'steamid': '76561198130196459', 'num_games_owned': 444, 'num_reviews': 70, 'playtime_forever': 375, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 374, 'last_played': 1558720708}
review:
Kütüphaneme kendi kendine gelen bu güzel oyun nedir?2D platformer tarzında olan parkur + shooter oynumuzda oldukça bol boss savaşı yeri geldiğinde cidden zorlayan platform kısımları.Bunlara karşın oyun mekanikleir oldukça zevkli ve kolay alışılabiliyorsunuz.Neyse ben size hikayeden anlayabildiğim kadarıyla anlatmaya çalışıyım.

Gelecekten gelen kendimiz hemen burdan gitmeliyiz benimle gel diyor ve dev bir yengeç tarafından kaçırılıyor.Kaçırılırken elinden lazer silahını düşürüyor ve oyunun burda başlıyor.Genelde İnception olan bir oyun.Ancak boss savaşları birbirinden oldukça farklı.Köpekbalığı ile savaşmak elinde lazer silahı olan dinazorlarla kapışmak güzel şeyler.Bossun canı belli bi miktarda azaldığında patternı değişiyor ve genelde bütün patternlarını öğrenirken birkaç kere ölüyorsunuz.Çünkü normal sıkarken mermi cehennemi moduna geçince afallıyor insan.
Neyse anlatabileceğim son şey şapka toplamak bölümlerde gizli yerlerde kullanabileceğimiz şapkalar bulunuyor.Peki bu şapkalar ne işe yarıyor?Tabii ki de hiçbir şeye yaramıyor sadece kozmetik.Başka anlatabileceğim birşey kalmadı oyun böyle karar sizin ister alıp oynarsınız ister bunu okuduktan sonra ilginizi çekmez ve almazsınız.

author: {'steamid': '76561198137383735', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 188, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 188, 'last_played': 1501349729}
review:
This game is so good! My first impression was a browser game with no sense and stupid storyline, but after finishing it I was so surprised. Levels are very funny and you must have a bit of skill otherwise you can't finish this game beacause difficulty is pretty balanced as you advance in the game. The graphic has the classic cartoon style but for this game is perfect. But this game is not all roses, cause there are two main issues. The first is the game longevity, which is about 2 hours if you're fast and 3 hours if you're slow (like me :D), but there are also many other workshop maps that you can play. The second and most important issue are controls, which aren't perfect, especially for some characters.

CONCLUSION
I would reccomend this game to anyone who is bored and wants a funny/casual game. Trust me that it's worth it :D

author: {'steamid': '76561198042294733', 'num_games_owned': 2915, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 434, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 397, 'last_played': 1648719675}
review:
The original release of No Time To Explain was plagued by performance issues, but thanks to this re-release (which owners of the original recieved for free), those issues have been squashed. Which is great, becasue the game itself is a ton of fun. Gleefully frustrating, completely off-the-wall wacky, brilliant soundtrack, and hey, you can eat cake while shooting lazers at dinosaurs. 

If you like platformers and games that make you laugh, then this'll be right up your alley.

author: {'steamid': '76561198047175821', 'num_games_owned': 268, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 2150, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 153, 'last_played': 1474741173}
review: I got this game for free for preordering another game or something.  I think for having Speedrunnerrs?  The game itself isn't that bad.  The graphics are something from the flash era of NewGrounds.  But that isn't inherently bad.  There is no real tutorial or any way to find help other than a quick google.  But the kicker is trying to get the game to start in the first place.  I read forum after forum thread after thread.  Then one day the thing started working.  Playing the game can be fun.  But it really isn't worth the price of admission when it takes hours to get a game to play.

author: {'steamid': '76561198139104167', 'num_games_owned': 166, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 842, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 605, 'last_played': 1663803352}
review: There's something incredible about this game, something magical, something astounding. It's sad that some are blind to it. Some say, "It's too short! 15$ for, like, 100-odd short levels? No, sir!" To that I say, "Have you played this game on mute?" The sounds in this game are like a symphony. The music adds a whole layer of replayability to the game. "Sick, Sick Mind" is one of my favorites of both this game and of all time. Just that is enough, but the dialouge is incredible. The jokes are to die for. However, a game crumbles without solid, entertaining gameplay. Sadly, there are a couple of levels and fights this game would benifit from being abolished completely, but 95% of the time, No Time To Explain aims and hits amazing, interesting gameplay. Even the story, which is supposed to be complicated, confusing and impossible to piece together is surprisingly enjoyable and deep. In short, a pros and cons list would be almost unnecessary.

review: The horrible controls are just not worth it. In the short time I've spent with this game it showed some half-decent humour and a few interesting hooks and twists with its mechanics, collectibles, and secrets. However I simply couldn't continue forcing myself to deal with the horrible controls. I got the game from a Humble Bundle so I haven't lost much, but definitely don't buy this at full price. At a 80-90% discount it might be worth a gamble if you set your expectations low, but otherwise STAY AWAY.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995760801', 'num_games_owned': 950, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 97, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 97, 'last_played': 1498988681}
review:
본 평가는 패드는 꽂기 귀찮아서 키보드 / 마우스로 진행한 평가입니다.

일단 조작감이 '매우' 구립니다.
다른 리뷰에도 있지만 마우스로 조준해서 쏘고 반동을 이용해 진행하는 방식입니다만.
마우스 포인터가 화면밖으로 나가기 일쑤고 쏘다보면 마우스 위치는 신경쓰기 힘들다 보니 결국 조작 자체가 힘듭니다.
거기다 빠른 게임 진행속도까지 더해서 진행이 매우 고통스럽습니다.
대표적 플랫포머 마리오가 편한 조작과 어려운 스테이지로 플랫포머의 교과서라면 이 작품은 정 반대입니다. 좋은 평가는 힘들단거죠.

그리고 가격에 비해 짧은 진행시간도 매우 아쉽네요. 물론 즐길거리도 많지 않습니다.
창작마당이 지원되나 그 나물에 그밥.  플랫포머의 한계라면 어쩔 수 없긴 하지만 취향이 아니라면 있으나 마나입니다.
정가주고 사긴 매우 아쉬운 제품입니다.
이런 부류의 플랫포머를 좋아하신다면 나쁘진 않으나, 이런 게임이 취향이 아니라면 세일을 노리거나 거르길 추천합니다.

review:
No Time To Explain is an amazing blend of platformer and action, forcing players to plan out their route with limited time, so get re-

QUICK, THERE'S NO TIME TO EXPLAIN!

GRAB THAT GUN, SHOOT THAT GUY, HIT THE RED BUTTON, AND WIN THE GAME.

Good luck to anyone buying this game. It's... a blast.

author: {'steamid': '76561198011023031', 'num_games_owned': 516, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1748, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 113, 'last_played': 1498801960}
review: An overpriced web browser game. Controls are attrocious. Mechanics range from difficult to use to downright awful. The game saves your last safe platform you landed on before you died, rather than the furthest platform. This means if you accidentally fall to the beginning of a level and touch ground, then die, you are stuck at the beginning again. This, paired with the poor controls makes the game infuriating for all the wrong reasons. Only reason I have this game is because I got it from a Humble Bundle. There are much better platformer games at this price. Skip this one.

review:
El juego es muy corto, pero lo que lo hace un gran juego es su historia simple con un poco de humor.
Niveles desafiantes algunas veces, si tratas de completarlo al 100% te felicito, porque los coleccionables que tienen escondidos en el juego te dara un poco más de tiempo de entretención. 
Recomendable a cualquier persona que le gusta el humor absurdo.
El soundtrack es respetable para un juego así 7,5/10
Graficos; Es un indie, no los necesita, pero pulirlo un poco más si quieren llamarlo remasterización 7/10
Historia; Soy tu del futuro, no hay tiempo para explicarte lo que sucede, solo juegalo y... AHHH un cangrejo gigante me a atrapado!!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198119428162', 'num_games_owned': 645, 'num_reviews': 148, 'playtime_forever': 472, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 472, 'last_played': 1497443241}
review:
Açıklayacak zaman yok (No Time To Explain) diye hayatımıza dalış yapan ve hızlı temposuyla devam eden bir platform oyunu.  Gelecekten gelen klonlarımızı kurtarma peşinde portal portal gezerek bölümleri bitirip her bölüm sonunda boss bulunduran eğlenceli bir oyundu. Bölüm zorlukları genelde çok zor gözüksede püf noktası öğrenildiğinde oldukça kolay bir şekilde geçebilme imkanı sunuyor. Bu nedenle çokça deneme dışında fazla da zorlandığımı söyleyemem.

Seneryosu ve kendine has mizahı ile gülümseten bir oyun.  Ancak seneryoyu bitirdiğimizde kazanılan başarımı oyuna sahip olanların sadece %6-7 si alabilmiş. Yani oyunu bitiren kişi sayısı oldukça az. Bu nedenle herkesin beğeniceği tarzda bir oyun olmayacağını söyleyebilirim. Oyunda her bölümden topladığımız şapkalar var. Açıkçası ne işe yaradığınıda bilmediğim için hepsini toplamaya çalışmadım.

Oyun puanı: 6/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198143019740', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 559, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 559, 'last_played': 1497349004}
review:
通关并且全收集了帽子，感觉这游戏的难度还是比较适中的
有些关卡需要耐心，但没有能卡的人死去活来想弃坑的点。障碍设置不断推陈出新，每过一个小节都能让人有新鲜感和成就感，好评！
另外，开游戏时的音效非常吵，注意……

author: {'steamid': '76561198218692180', 'num_games_owned': 1071, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 434, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 392, 'last_played': 1497963739}
review:
没时间解释了，来自未来的你刚要带你走就被带走了，荒诞的剧情带来了很不错的游戏体验
游戏中你的武器也是你移动的重要工具
操作上有一点点不顺畅，不过也可能是我手残的原因。。

音乐很带感，画风也看着挺舒服

总评：五星好评

ps：本来以为地鼠是最后一个boss，靠着毅力和决心好不容易把地鼠打死，结果看着后面又新开的关卡地图，看着接下来的至少10个关卡，手残表示受不了了。。

附：
地鼠之前感觉就鲨鱼和地鼠的难度大点
鲨鱼的第二阶段我靠卖命过的，没什么参考价值
地鼠的话，建议不要跳到两边的坑里面躲避，因为地鼠的第二阶段你是不能跳坑里的，这样会不习惯
所以地鼠建议在平台上跳起来躲避地鼠

author: {'steamid': '76561197996919908', 'num_games_owned': 1532, 'num_reviews': 875, 'playtime_forever': 197, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 197, 'last_played': 1496501389}
review:
[h1]Der absolute Wahnsinn! [/h1]

Ich wollte schon lange das erste Spiel von TinyBuild, "No Time To Explain Remastered" spielen, die 15 € waren mir aber etwas zu happig. Jetzt hab ichs endlich über ein Humble Bundle bekommen und ich bereue nichts!

[b]Gameplay[/b]
"No Time To Explain" ist ein 2D Jump 'n' Run, welches sehr gut umgesetzt wurde und mich persönlich auch leicht an "Super Meat Boy" erinnert. 

Schon zu Beginn des Spiels bekommen wir unseren Blaster, mit dem wir höher springen können und ihn auch als Waffen benutzen. Umso höher wir springen, umso besser können wir auch mit dem Blaster fliegen. Schwierig wird es, wenn wir auf Etwas schießen und dabei nicht auf den Boden stehen, denn dann fliegt man doch leicht unkontrolliert. Das Spiel ist selber in bestimmte Levelbereiche aufgesplittet, wovon jeder 1-5 Level lang ist und meistens einen Boss beinhaltet. Nach knapp 3 Stunden war ich durch, allerdings ist das Spiel nie langweilig geworden, da einfach wirklich alle 5 Minuten das Gameplay komplett auf den Kopf gedreht wurde und man sich wirklich immer mit neuen Features beschäftigen musste. Dabei gibt das Spiel aber meistens ein einfaches Level voraus, wodurch man sich flüssig mit der neuen Spielmechanik anfreunden kann. Und natürlich gibt es in fast jedem Level ein Sammelobjekt, in diesem Fall sind es lustige Hüte. Ich würde das Spiel weiterhin als recht schwer bezeichnen, insbesondere bei einem Boss saß ich lange fest. Hat man das Spiel durch, kann man sich entweder selber Level erstellen oder welche aus dem Workshop spielen. Die Community hat hier sehr viel Fantasie und Kreativität gelassen.


[b]Story[/b]
Der Name ist Programm. Die Story ist einfach durch und genau deswegen konnten die Entwickler einfach alles mit diesem Spiel machen. Ständig passiert irgendetwas total abgedrehtes und Verrücktes. Irgendetwas mit Dinosauriern, dem "Ich" aus der Zukunft, dem Bösewicht, einem Rugby Spieler und irgendwelchen durchgeknallten Monstern. Das Spiel nimmt viele Klischees auf die Schippe und parodiert auch andere Spiele, so z.B. Minecraft. Aber auch die eigenen Spielszenen werden  immer wieder verarscht. Man mags kaum glauben, aber tatsächlich folgt das Spiel einer Geschichte und es ist nicht alles nur zusammengewürfelt. Aber es bleibt absolut genialer Nonsense! Die Charaktere hauen einfach mega geile Sprüche raus und die Zwischensequenzen sind einfach zum Totlachen. Dieses Spiel hat einen so geilen Humor, ich bekam beim Spielen einfach feuchte Augen, weil ich ausm Lachen net mehr rauskam.


[b]Grafik/Sound[/b]
Das Spiel wirkt fast, als ob es mit Paint kreiert wurde und genau dieser oberflächliche Stil passt wie die Faust aufs Auge. Es wirkt ein wenig wie ein buntes Comic und mit dieser durchgeknallten Geschichte verbunden, ist es absolut passend.
Der Sound schließt sich dem problemlos an: Vom dumpfen Aufklatschen bis hin zur sehr geilen Synchronisation!
Sehr hilfreich ist auch, dass wir ein Audiofeedback bekommen, wenn wir einem Gegner wirklich Schaden zufügen.
Die Musik hat sich wie das Gameplay auch ständig geändert und es ist fast alles dabei, von elektronischer Begleitmusik zum Metal. Verdammt, selbst Beethovens "Für Elise" war dabei, wobei ich da, vom Kontext her. beinahe vor Lachen vom Stuhl gefallen wäre.


[b]Fazit[/b]
"No Time To Explain" ist eine wahre Indieperle und ich hab dieses Spiel absolut ins Herz geschlossen. Das Gameplay ändert sich ständig, wird nicht langweilig und deswegen habe ich das Spiel auch fast am Stück durchgespielt. Die Grafik und die Musik sorgen einfach ständig für neue Überraschungen und man hat auch durch die sehr lustige Geschichte immer was zum Lachen. Das Spiel ist einfach ein einziger Witz, aber ein verdammt guter. Ich persönlich hatte schon lange kein Spiel mehr, wo ich derart oft lachen musste. Außerdem wirkt es so wunderbar unverbraucht und frisch, dass mir mal wieder klar wurde, warum ich Indiespiele so liebe. Wer den Trailer gesehen hat, sollte wissen, dass das Spiel noch 10-mal abstruser und lustiger ist. Für knapp 3-4 Stunden, Workshop mal ausgenommen, sind 15 € nicht wenig. Aber dafür kauft man hier jede Menge Spaß und daher bin ich mir bei dieser Empfehlung so sicher, wie ich es selten bin!



Wenn dir das Review gefallen hat, würde ich mich freuen, wenn du [url=http://steamcommunity.com/groups/Drakeschool] meiner Kuratorgruppe auf Steam [/url]folgst, um auch meine Reviews zu anderen Spielen zu bekommen.

author: {'steamid': '76561198019328070', 'num_games_owned': 470, 'num_reviews': 136, 'playtime_forever': 171, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 171, 'last_played': 1496388043}
review:
I thought this was a pretty fun platformer - it takes some getting used to, but the controls are an interesting variant. Some of the humor was worth a chuckle, some of it didn't quite land. All the levels introduce a new twist on the mechanic, which keeps it interesting. The bosses were all fun to play. My favorite stage was the black & white one where you had to "paint" the walls to see what you were supposed to do - sadly, this stage was followed by the Rejected Clone level, or as I like to refer to it, God's Greatest Mistake.

I got this through Humble Bundle - not sure I would drop 15 bucks for it by itself, but it's a good time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009236488', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 392, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 392, 'last_played': 1495841458}
review:
'Salright. 

Not 15 euros alright, but 'salright. I'd feel dissatisfied if I didn't get it cheap from a bundle.

Gets frustrating sometimes, cause the controls could have been better. I played it with mouse/kb, so it's not terribly unwieldy, but I imagine playing it with a controller is borderline impossible. and there are several segments where gameplay changes a bit, which wouldn't be a problem as it isn't so complex that you couldn't figure it out, but the controls will feel a bit janky, and I did feel like I was making due with the controls rather than having them as an extention of myself.

There are some mechanics that I'm pretty sure are an exploit the devs overlooked, and not a clever inclusion.
I did have a problem playing it full screen, where you get black stripes on the top and bottom of the screen, because of the resolution of the game, and I wouldn't bring it up, except your cursor can get lost in it, so it's kind of hard to see where you're aiming.

But despite all that, it is a kinda neat platform/puzzler. I just wouldn't get it unless it's 5 euros or cheaper.
I didn't talk about the mechanics of the game, cause figuring them out is part of the fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561198313305019', 'num_games_owned': 985, 'num_reviews': 62, 'playtime_forever': 286, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 81, 'last_played': 1574495368}
review:
[spoiler]won this game in giveaway on Steamgifts[/spoiler]

I have not played original [b]No Time To Explain[/b], so I don't know difference between it and remastered version, so I'll just list things that I found good and/or bad in remastered version:

+ First of all, what makes [b]No Time To Explain Remastered[/b] different from other games is it's gameplay style. Besides interesting graphics, you'll find lots of comedy and entertaining things in it, for example - memes in form of hats and voice acting.

- Difficulty of the game, which is mostly caused by small bugs in game, for example - jumping with your laser gun does not always work in a way you want.

At last - would I recommend game to others? - Of course! But not at full price. $15 is a little too much for this game. I would rather buy it on sale or in bundle.

Final score: 7/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198133565082', 'num_games_owned': 2227, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 198, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 198, 'last_played': 1495521652}
review: This is an old 2D side scroller that might be called a "precision platformer" if it was released today. Although your character can run and jump, the game is largely based around using your laser beam both to shoot enemies and as a jetpack type thruster. It is difficult to describe how poorly this is implemented. The "jetpack" provides different arbitrary levels of thrust depending on which direction it is pointed and when it's fired. Some reviewers claim that some hidden random number generator controls the output, but that is not true -- the physics are total nonsense but they are the same nonsense every time. Aiming directly at the ground and firing always produces the same strange slo-mo super jump. Aiming to the left or right on the ground always pushes you the opposite direction with no acceration whatsoever. Jumping and firing left or right  sends you hurtling across the screen like scarecrow strapped to a jet engine. Jumping and firing down does basically nothing. Firing right/left and then swinging the thruster down results in nothing: no super jump, even if you are grounded. It makes no sense and feels deeply unsatisfying but it can be learned. Helpfully, the checkpoints come quickly and the game is mercifully over after three hours or so. Sprinkled on top of the central dysfunction are various other mechanics, including a piece of cake that transformes you into a fat bowling ball and a truly  wretched bullet hell sequence. These are mere diversions though -- little more than mini games. The meat of NTTE is imprecise "precision" platforming punctuated by infuriating boss fights. All of this is wrapped in a moldy layer of newgrounds style early internet humor. I hated hated HATED this game. Forget paying, this is just not worth your time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198127331673', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 54, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 20, 'last_played': 1495186359}

author: {'steamid': '76561197968258381', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 124, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 124, 'last_played': 1495479932}
review:
The premise of the game revolves around a terrible control scheme.  The game's defining feature, shooting to move, is a great concept that has been done in games before but this one executes it poorly.  The cursor regularly needs to be aimed off screen and, while the cursor is not trapped by the screen, there's no indicator for where it is being aimed.  Movement also moves the cursor which makes aiming for particular targets very difficult. Spacebar, a key which usualyl means jump, instead does nothing.  Well, it does do something but it's not relevant to movement.  Sometimes levels mix up the control scheme, like the shotgun level or the telekenesis level, but they really feel like explored concepts that were wedged into the game instead of being rightfully discarded.

There's a lot of dying and retrying in this game, which isn't necessarily bad, but the pacing of retries is no where on the level of Super Meat Boy.  Some times dying, like flying off screen in the cake world, takes an extraordinary amount of time.  Sometimes dying resets the whole level, except this triggers the slow fadeout/fadein.  I loved the theme, but the gameplay is too much of a hassle.

author: {'steamid': '76561198167130220', 'num_games_owned': 70, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 414, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 180, 'last_played': 1495562423}
review:
Pour les 6 ans No Time To Explain, TinyBuild nous propose une version remasterisée de son premier jeu, initialement sorti en 2011.
Il s'agit là d'un jeu bourré d'humour et d'action en non-stop, avec une histoire bien wtf. Vos armes vous serviront à tuer, mais aussi et surtout à vous déplacer. Un jeu simple, un principe qui le démarque des autres et une bonne dose d'humour, et c'est terriblement efficace.

Je recommande grandement !
Petits plus : 
> jouable en coop !
> un mode de déplacement inédit
> le héros possède de très nombreuses têtes à débloquer dans le jeu.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043974607', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 163, 'playtime_forever': 181, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 181, 'last_played': 1495381480}
review:
Dans la famille jeu meta, je voudrais le grand-père !
Plein de bonnes idées de gameplay, se renouvelle beaucoup, super long par rapport à d'autres, bref, beaucoup de bonnes choses. Gros bonus : le coop local est marrant.

Seuls petits bémols : la physique du jetpack-gun est assez difficile à appréhender, il faut un gros temps d'adaptation, et la difficulté est en dents de scie étant donnés les énormes changements de gameplay rencontrés. Pas assez pour gâcher le plaisir.

author: {'steamid': '76561198146682116', 'num_games_owned': 1052, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 355, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 187, 'last_played': 1668643796}
review:
I played No Time To Explain when it was just a flash game, all was excellent the voice acting, gameplay and difficulty levels. To me this is a very good game even if most critics from 2017 are negative for it.
I'd recommend at least trying it, it's cheap on every key-selling site and contains what we could expect from an indie game.
It may not be as good as other tinyBuild games but it's the game that made them feel like a real company, their first game.

The music of the Credits is also truly beautiful, nice remix of Triple Gear

author: {'steamid': '76561197982727216', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 115, 'playtime_forever': 16, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 16, 'last_played': 1494809919}
review:
I'm sure this game will appeal to some hardcore platforming fans (especially those who enjoy Super Meat Boy, etc) but it was just too difficult and annoying for me.  Some levels are extremely demanding and hearing the same screaming death cries becomes super irritating.  I know I didn't play for long, but I got so frustrated that I Rage Quit.  (I still haven't fully figured out the first ray gun controls.)  Recommended only if super cheap.  Certainly not at $15.

PROS

+ Cute art style
+ Physics-based puzzle platforming with lots of levels and challenges
+ Different "gun style" platforming sections keeps things fresh

CONS

- Hearing the same death screams are funny at first but quickly become annoying
- Keyboard and mouse controls are confusing and frustrating
- Some levels require split-second timing and precision
- Constant deaths in difficult levels often caused me to Rage Quit

author: {'steamid': '76561198010997388', 'num_games_owned': 831, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 44, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 44, 'last_played': 1494714336}
review:
I got this game a while ago and seeing it pop up in the Humble Bundle made me think this was a good time to revisit it.
Unfortunately, I can't *not* recommend this game enough. I know I haven't played much of it but that's not for lack of trying.

Pros:
Apparently, if you play enough of it, it has a story that's not too bad?

Cons:
- Controls.
The controls are absolutely infuriating. You walk at a snail's pace and the jump is so pitiful that it may as well have been removed from the game. You "jump" about as high as your character is tall which makes it good for literally nothing. All of your movement comes from your weapon.
- Sound.
The music seems to be a poor attempt at a callback to retro games but it's repetetive and grating. It's a fully-voiced game, and on top of the poor sound quality the "jokes" fall flat. All of its humor comes from a "lol so randomz!" standpoint, resulting in a weak chuckle the first time one comes up and an apologetic sigh the following times. In my half hour of play I heard "My insides and my outsides are in pain!" literally 10 times.
- Gameplay.
The biggest issue I have with this is that the gameplay itself just... isn't fun. Sure, it's a difficult platformer, but the difficulty comes from the controls rather than clever design. It has a few ideas that it toys around with for a level or two but never revisits them. It's usually an infinite-life platformer but will then toss you into a boss fight where suddenly lives are a thing. The boss fights are frustrating and give no information on what a boss can or will do until you've already died to it, a problem worsened by the fact that you die while just trying to get into position thanks to the poor controls.

Tl;dr, it's an interesting game that looks far more fun in the trailers than it actually is. The game just isn't worth it to play but looks interesting enough to try. It'd be a dissappointing game if it were $5, but selling this for $15 is insane.

author: {'steamid': '76561198068257137', 'num_games_owned': 336, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 182, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 126, 'last_played': 1510496195}

review:
Happy I was able to get this for $1.00 off of a humble bundle, because honestly this game is nothing but troll bullshit. It's a game thats having an identity crisis, it doesn't know what it wants to be, It's TinyBuild's first game they ever made, and it's complete trash.

Reasoning for this: Delayed controls, Terrible control mapping, useless jump, useless walk, only thing that truly "controls" your character is the beam weapon, I put controls in quotes, because it doesn't control him, the beam weapon makes him fly around uncontrollably like an imbecile.

author: {'steamid': '76561197988437235', 'num_games_owned': 836, 'num_reviews': 61, 'playtime_forever': 399, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 399, 'last_played': 1494289587}
review:
Product received for free as an update of the old Flash version of the game.

So, there it is: The so called "remastered" edition of No Time To Explain, a game I had been looking forward to since the release of Steam Greenlight - a service that is due to disappear soon! Is the remaster any better? Well - yes! It feels like an actual game now. Is it good? In my opinion: Unfortunately, not really.

The new engine tries to hide the fact that the original was a flash project which tried to be much more than Flash could handle. And it makes the game feel much smoother and precise. However, many flaws weren't improved upon, e.g. the very subpar sound design. Maybe it isn't much a remaster than more a port of a Flash game into a non Flash based engine?

Anyway, as you can see, I did spend my time with this game and went for completion. Much frustration came from the fact that controls now were neither optimized for controller nor keyboard+mouse and to reset a level because of a failed attempt takes awfully long. To switch between control schemes you have to restart the game, the menuing is a mystery... I feel bad for seemingly hating on this game so much but it just seems, the remaster didn't actually fix much of the flaws from the original. It's sad since the game could have been a fun experience. But let's not grieve towards this loss but instead look forward to what lies ahead, I am sure TinyBuild are able to see the flaws themselves (considering the stuff they went through to actually release the game) and improve in their repertoire!

author: {'steamid': '76561198307677063', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 39, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7, 'last_played': 1512263692}
review: I often play games without audio, as my hearing is a little weird. This is never a problem when I play games that aren't story-based, until I found this, I have no idea what is going on without audio. It's random and makes no sense. Subtitles would be helpful, if the characters say anything meaningful at all. The controls are also hard to get at first, and I am glad I got this for free. I would be banging my head against the wall if I spent $15 on this. The game is not interesting. I had hopes for this game, but it's just overhyped and overpriced.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025330870', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 79, 'playtime_forever': 147, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 147, 'last_played': 1493569550}
review: Unresponsive controls in some areas. The main mechanic of the game can be fun when it works as intended, but often times the force feels random. Lots of trial and error to get to the collectables. Restarting repeats mildly amusing(the first time) dialog that gets stale quicker than the game itself does. Recent reviews have it listed as "Mixed" A fair assessment I feel. If the concept strongly interests you I encourage you to wait for a decent sale for it to hit a worth its value price point.

author: {'steamid': '76561198134543787', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 334, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 334, 'last_played': 1493402915}
review:
This is one of those games, that are pretty fun to watch, but awful to play on your own. I really like most things about this game: the art, the humour, the "plot". BUT (and that's a big but) it's really hard and frustrating. And the reason behind that is NOT, that the game itself is difficult, it's just the awful controls that make it hard.
There are games that are challenging and have great controls AND there are games that are frustrating, because they have bad controls. This one is latter.

author: {'steamid': '76561198073976105', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 286, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 286, 'last_played': 1492934866}
review: I don't remember how I got this game. Did I pay for it? Did I get a key? I don't know. Assuming I got it for free, then don't get it at full price. It's really... not worth fifteen dollars. Half the price and sure! So get it on sale and have a good time with it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198157201361', 'num_games_owned': 889, 'num_reviews': 795, 'playtime_forever': 171, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 171, 'last_played': 1492928641}
review:
Pros
-has some interesting mechanics
-decent hardness
-interesting little platformer
-a few funny lines

Cons
-excessive screen shake (just finished the game and I now have a headache)
-many times your gun shoots you away harder or softer then other times which really throws off trajectories
-not clear on how to beat the mechanical mole (had to look up solution)
-story makes no sense (which is why there is no time to explain)

all in all its an ok platformer (if you decide to buy this only get it on a sale)

Edit: I decided to change my review because reflecting on my experience I didn't think this game is as good as what you could spend your time/money on with something else

author: {'steamid': '76561198119390591', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 184, 'playtime_forever': 1239, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1002, 'last_played': 1443909166}
review:
[h1] No Time To Explain Remastered [/h1]
[i] This is a very fun and well made platform game, but it is not one of the easiest to finish but its not too difficult too. The hero of the game is a person who leads a peaceful life until one afternoon falls into it through the wall, he himself from the future. Our goal is to get safely from the beginning of the level to the very end. Here comes the help of a jet rifle that we will use to finish the level and fight bosses. In my opinion it offers a great and intense gameplay, very funny moments, nice soundtrack and graphic. I sincerely recommend it to everyone who did not play it. [/i]

author: {'steamid': '76561198172925593', 'num_games_owned': 14023, 'num_reviews': 4533, 'playtime_forever': 1267, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 355, 'last_played': 1492649242}
review:
It's cool …………
大概这游戏的翻译应该是 “别说了，快上车”

游戏操作简单，一把武器走天下，能射能飞（靠反作用力）
另外还有按住空格的跳舞小彩蛋
剧情貌似是无限时间轮转，无数个自己，无数个未来可能

游戏过程主要分为动作过关和BOSS战
每一小关都很短，基本上几秒到十几秒，所以难度上来说并不算非常高
多试几次甚至几十次肯定能过，主要是一些帽子的收集，有全收集指南
http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=484155371

同样BOSS战主要难点在了解打法上，因为只有4条命，全死了就要重打，所以没办法磨死BOSS的
BOSS战个人心得
http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=893743796

另外几个成就有点难度，比如多少时间内完成某些关卡什么的，反而完成故事模式应该说是相对简单的一个

author: {'steamid': '76561198069452666', 'num_games_owned': 427, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 26, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 26, 'last_played': 1476552082}
review:
At first I thought it was a virus on my pc I just got. Then I downloaded it like I would any other video game, after I ran it i started to think that maybe instead it wasn't a virus but a well thought out program that came to life. 

Anyways, the begginning to the game really caught me off gaurd but as i steadily progressed past the inensive screaming of my future self I realized that its really fun and something to pass the time, before I knew I had played for a good hour. I just couldnt help it, I enjoyed hearing my future self scream for help as I waded through walls and walls of dirt with my amazing energy cannon.

Did I mention there is an energy cannon?

author: {'steamid': '76561198019689967', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 27, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 27, 'last_played': 1567808107}
review:
I played the original flashgame back in the day, and since then have been curious about playing this full game.

No, don't get it. It is just bad. I wouldn't pay $5 for this game, $15 is highway robbery.

Controls don't feel responsive, level design is awful and lazy. The game doesn't even have resolution options.

Edit: I'm also pretty sure the devs are engaging in review manipulation, as the average review has skyrocketed from "Mixed" to "Very Positive" in just the past month.

author: {'steamid': '76561198062448641', 'num_games_owned': 2313, 'num_reviews': 305, 'playtime_forever': 509, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 262, 'last_played': 1601061798}
review:
[h1]Джизас Крайст![/h1]

Забавный, иногда муторный в прохождении инди-платформер, что оригинал, что ремастер (что логично, зачем изобретать велосипед?). У нас тут есть шапки, разные миры со своими особыми версиями прохождения этапов, а по сути - разнообразие геймплея в однообразной игре. Ремастер бесплатно выдали купившим оригинал ранее, и за это спасибо большое)
В остальном же: хорошая убивалка времени и нервов (если не смогли пройти этап с большим количеством воды и высоким берегом - попробуйте выбраться прямо из воды, у меня получилось где-то с двадцатой попытки).
Удачи в освоении хороших игр)

[url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/32313063/] Куратор	[/url]

Ставьте лайк, подписывайтесь на кураторскую страничку и ищите новое в играх!)

review: No Time To Explain Remastered é com certeza uma melhoria em relação ao seu antecessor. A versão anterior era feita em flash (o que deixava o jogo muito travado às vezes) e mal polida. Como eu já possuía o anterior, recebi a versão remasterizada de graça, e posso dizer com toda a certeza que recomendo. Sendo feita agora em Unity, essa versão mantém o humor nonsense, a gameplay única e variada do original, e adiciona mais coisas, como Multiplayer Local.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971930833', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 131, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 131, 'last_played': 1488037002}
review:
The story is funny but the game is a pot-luck based die-a-lot-hope-you-hit-the-right-bit kinda thing. The variety in items you get to blast your way around each level gives a nice break from the usual platform jumper. Wtih most games like this I tend to feel a sense of achievement as well as frustration but I found completing levels were so based off of luck that I never got the sense of achievement, instead it was about how long I could be bothered to keep trying again and again till it worked.

Bosses were the best bit of the game though. Not worth getting just for that but they were fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561198259001525', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 39, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9, 'last_played': 1502434045}

author: {'steamid': '76561198069092496', 'num_games_owned': 4112, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 271, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 271, 'last_played': 1487799780}
review:
I Don't understand why this game has so many positive reviews. If you do like this game, feel free to explain it to me in the comments (but know that I can't resond).

I found the controls to be unresponsive and unpredictable. movement without your 'jump gun' is so slow it's pointless, and movement with it is rather odd. For example: If you shoot down whilst on the ground you fly way up into the air, but if you shoot left or right, you nearly don't move at all. If you jump just before using the gun you get no lift at all. 
I found it to be quite frustrating that I never quite knew where I was going to move next, which in a precision platformer like this just feels wrong. I thnk the creator of the game knew this, which is why there are so many checkpoints so close to each other.

The hit detection I also found to be unclear. There seems to be an invisible area around the character that makes it so that you get hit even if your sprite was not. This problem and the problem above make it so that the game, and the bossfights in particular, just feel like trial and error. As if you're never really fully in control and responsible for what happens on-screen.

The story is ok. The time travel trope is funny in the beginning, but just kind of peters out near the middle of the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198150852209', 'num_games_owned': 1498, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 172, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 152, 'last_played': 1537082239}
review:
説明している暇はない!!
と書くとレビューにならないためムービーで拾えない内容を捕捉。


・ストーリークリア自体は数時間
・死んで覚えるゲー
・レーザーカノン使用のステージが多め
・各ステージはチェックポイント制(一部例外あり)
・ボス戦はチェックポイントなしの残機制
・一部シーンにゴア(欠損)表現あり

難易度はキャラ操作技術を要するステージを上手く乗り越えられるか否かで印象が変わる。
運が良ければすぐにクリア可能だが、そうでないと時間を要する。

しかし、リスポンの速度は速いためストレスレスでステージ攻略に挑める。

死にゲーが苦手でなくムービーのノリが気に入ったら買い。
ただし、定価分の価値を見いだせるかはプレイヤー次第。

author: {'steamid': '76561198087604225', 'num_games_owned': 726, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 44, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 44, 'last_played': 1487532126}
review:
My 45 Minute experience:
     I used to play this game when it was still in browser. I liked it then because it was fun and easy to play. It was also a good way to waste some time. That was years ago though. Now that I've played it again, it seems a lot harder to get the main way of travel to work. It just doesn't feel right and it has it's own temper. It is fun though. just a simple click and move to the portal game, with a few boss fights. The options are very limited, but the only options you would need. I wish I could have turned off the screen shake because that gives me a headache to look at for an extended period of time. 

     Overall it is an okay game. I will go back to it if I need some time to waste, but I'm going to go out of my way to beat it. 5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198050856670', 'num_games_owned': 363, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 70, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 70, 'last_played': 1487515064}
review:
I was actually a bit upset when I finally got around to playing this game. Everything I heard about it was positive. The controls were new and inventive, it was humorous, the level design was great. But the more I played it, the more stuff I found that I really did not like at all.

The controls are awful. You use WSAD to move and jump, and the spacebar makes you dance, because I suppose the devs thought the 2 second dance from the beginning of the game was hilarious enough to throw into the control scheme. Dancing is like a taunt in fighting games. It doesnt do anything. You then use the mouse to guide the giant laser that you shoot. Only your cursor also moves with your character. Not with the screen, your character. If you move left, the cursor moves left. WHO THOUGHT THAT WOULD BE A GOOD IDEA? It makes the physics-based puzzles so much harder than they actually are. But aside from the controls, there were a lot of other things I started questioning.

-Why is the game locked to 720p? It just makes it look dated and confined.
-Why are the alternate weapons just used as gimmicks for specific puzzles?
-If the devs opted to include voice acting, why dont their mouths move?
-Why do I have infinite lives for the entire game, but only 3 for boss fights?
-Why are the boss fights the only actual enemies in the game?
-Why doesnt the level selection have any info on the level you are playing? I cant even tell which one I left off on when I go back to play the game.

Then there is the game's "humor" if I can even call it that. This game has 2 jokes throughout the entire game. The first is the rampant screaming you hear your future self yell in the first few levels, which jus gets annoying when you realize the devs only recorded about 12 phrases that just get looped over and over again. The second joke comes directly from the title, and what I mean by that is they dont explain anything and just expect you to find it humorous and accept it, which I dont. WHY IS a giant crab trying to kill me? WHY IS there a random UFO? WHY IS there a giant groundhog with a drill in its mouth as a boss? If you didnt want to explain anything, why make so much stuff that needs explaining? Random does not equal funny.

On a final note, the game is not terrible, but it has enough problems to a point where it feels like a beta. I expected more from a "remastered" game. That being said, the game's strong point is the levels. Playing through them was fun, and if it was just that it would be an awesome arcade-style game. But with the immense number of bad things I found in the game, I can not recommend it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993320740', 'num_games_owned': 976, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 300, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 300, 'last_played': 1487422085}
review:
All around, a good game. I found the controls a bit hard to get used to at first, but you adapt easily. It's a fun little two- to four-hour time-waster depending on if you just want a casual romp through the game or if you're going for all the hats and achievements...

...speaking of achievements, the "Steedrun" achievement can, with all due respect, go f*ck itself. You will die. You will die often. You will die in easily preventable ways. And each death will force you to go back to the hub world and re-enter, wasting countless minutes that turn into hours.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007655039', 'num_games_owned': 1248, 'num_reviews': 65, 'playtime_forever': 90, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 90, 'last_played': 1487445531}
review:
When it sticks to it's short but challenging platforming levels that respawn you at the last safe place you touched before you die it's at it's best.

The boss fights detract from this experience in forcing you to replay from the beginning after too many deaths, making them much more frustrating than the rest of the game (although this is far from the only reason they are frustrating)

Despite the flaws it's a nice little game that you'll get a few good, but sometimes rage inducing hours out of.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040849065', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 259, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 259, 'last_played': 1486694341}
review:
I just played through this game's main storyline in one session. Here's what I think:

The Good:
+ The beam gun and the flinging shotgun are innovative plattforming mechanics.
+ The levels are visually varied and generally well designed. Checkpoints are usually placed quite generously and fairly.
+ Each chapter introduces new temporary environmental mechanics, which makes for a shortwhiled experience.
+ The overall pacing of the levels is quite good, none of the chapters or mechanics outstay their welcome.
+ Collecting hats is  a fun way to customise your character and provides a nice layer of additional challenge in most stages.
+ Some of the hats are downright ridiculous and so is the main stoyline. The humour is definitely debatable, very slapstick-esque and lol-so-random, but I think it's safe to say that if the trailer for this game appeals to you then you will enjoy the plot.
+ The original soundtrack kicks ass and is surprisingly varied.
+ The voice acting is ridiculously over the top and probably the main contributing factor to this game's hillarity.
+ The meta-commentary on video games and game design seemed a little out of place, but I enjoyed it regardless.
+ Steam Workshop support, additional levels, and the challenge of trying to collect all the hats and all the achievements should be enough incentive to keep playing for those masochistic enough to want to do so.

The Bad:
- In almost every chapter there will be one stage that is extremely hard in comparison to the rest. This seems in part due to these stages having less generous checkpoints than usual or sometimes none at all. These random difficulty spikes can be very frustrating and are a testament to the fact that this was a debut game by a small company. Definitely could have used some more playtesting.

- The game keeps its promise to not explain anything. You have to figure out every new mechanic by yourself and make creative use of your movement abilites to forge your path through the levels. This is of course where the challenge of the game comes from, but I think it is safe to say it does not hold your hand. As a result, I sometimes found myself having to cross-references videos of other people's playthroughs to make sure my approach to traversing the level was correct and it was only my execution that sucked.

- The bossfights in particular are quite hard. They all have set rotations that you'll have to figure out for yourself. The game generally tries to give visual and auditive clues as to what you should be doing, but oftentimes it is unclear how many stages a fight has. Bosses also never have a healthbar, instead the game relies purely on different visual stages of the bosses' models which makes the progress of the fight feel vague at times.

-Playing the game with a controller seemed fine, but there were a few stages where I found myself switching back to mouse and keyboard as the chapter-specific mechanics seemed easier to handle that way.

- The main campaign can be finished in around 3-4 hours. This might be a consideration for some people, although as I said the game is overall very enjoyable and shortwhiled.

- The original price tag of 15 euros/dollars is a little too high in my opinion. Although it's definitely worth picking up on sale for a reduced price, probably more around the 5-8 euros/dollars mark.

author: {'steamid': '76561198080969908', 'num_games_owned': 133, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 26, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 26, 'last_played': 1486176037}
review:
If your looking for a review on this game you've come to the wrong place, but if your looking for an outstanding pie recipe you've come to the right place.

Ingredients:
1. 6 tablespoons unsalted butter
2. 1/2 cup white sugar
3. 1/2 cup brown sugar
4. 1/4 cup water
5. 1/4 teaspoon cinnamon
6. 1 pinch salt
7. 5 apples - peeled, cored and sliced
8. 1 pastry for double-crust pie 

Directions:
1. Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C).
2. Combine butter, white sugar, brown sugar, water, cinnamon, and salt in a saucepan over medium heat. Bring to a boil, remove from heat and set aside.
3. Roll out half the pastry to fit a 9-inch pie plate. Place bottom crust in pie plate; pour in apple slices.
4. Roll out top crust into a 10-inch circle. Cut into 8 (1-inch) wide strips with a sharp paring knife or pastry wheel. Weave the pastry strips, one at a time, into a lattice pattern. Fold the ends of the lattice strips under the edge of the bottom crust and crimp to seal.
5. Pour butter-sugar mixture over top of pie, coating the lattice, and allowing any remaining sauce to drizzle through the crust.
6. Bake in the preheated oven for 15 minutes. Reduce heat to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C), and bake until the crust is golden brown, the caramel on the top crust is set, and the apple filling is bubbling, 35 to 40 more minutes. Allow to cool completely before slicing.

________________________________________________

Anyways, love the simple aspect of the game.

Pros:
- A lot of levels
- Fun and simple graphics
- About everyone can run this game
- YOUR CHARACTER IS CONSTANTLY SCREAMING


Cons:
-YOUR CHARACTER IS CONSTANTLY SCREAMING

author: {'steamid': '76561198092361196', 'num_games_owned': 171, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 5, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5, 'last_played': 1485806535}
review:
Schöner Grafik-Stil 
Schnell, abwechslungsreich, lustig und am besten, es lässt sich intuitiv direkt spielen!

author: {'steamid': '76561198138738814', 'num_games_owned': 229, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 880, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 842, 'last_played': 1471456603}
review:
No Time To Explain  - это когда ты собрался со старыми друзьями и после пятого кексика с малинкой кто-то из них воскликнул "А давайте сделаем игру?". И все в ответ "Точно, мы просто обязаны сделать игру!"

У вас есть программист, музыкант и художник. Но вот беда - сценариста нет. Беда ли? Нет! Ведь у всех вас есть отличные идеи, принесённые безудержным весельем и кексами с еживикой! 

О чём это я? No Time To Explain - это фарш сумасбродных идей, который (к огромному, блин, удивлению) имеет сюжет с логичной (в каком-то из измерений точно!) концовкой. 

Если вам под силу отключить вашего внутреннего скептика и закутать стул под собой в фольгу во избежание подгораний - эта игра для вас!

9 (эти чертовы достижения!) кексов с идиотами из 10!

author: {'steamid': '76561198146139665', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 293, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 203, 'last_played': 1484471096}
review:
是哪个楼上说游戏很简单，玩几次就能过去的，我保证不打死你。感觉虽然有很多效果，但是其实很多过关套路冗杂，可能最烦人的还是boss关了，特别是打邪恶的自己？分分钟半小时过不去的节奏，而且不能调窗口大小这个很坑，动着动着就没办法看到鼠标了。最坑的在于，我有时会切出窗口看个消息，结果点回来时刚好点到退出返回到了选择关卡，没有多一次的提示，直接把我丢了出去，知道那种打过又打一遍的恐惧吗。
不管了，我手痛，我想给差评，光标移动太捉急了
但是看在通关的份上，我决定改成好评

如果一关卡了很久过不去的话，等一会心态恢复了再打吧（特别是像我这种暴躁的人）

author: {'steamid': '76561198047903521', 'num_games_owned': 334, 'num_reviews': 66, 'playtime_forever': 268, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 213, 'last_played': 1511995693}
review:
I loved the first game. Despite some serious issues (Hit Glitches, Bosses crashing the game, etc) I still loved the game and was able to enjoy it and ignore the bugs. Not only does the Remastered improve on some of the issues the first game had (Better Hat selection, fixed glitches and Boss fights) but also has a lot of improved controls and overall is just amazing. If you enjoyed the first game this is basically the same and much more improved.

If you're new then this game is amazing. Easy to play, hard to master. Funny story and beautiful graphics.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045376199', 'num_games_owned': 421, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 354, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 303, 'last_played': 1590115854}
review:
"I Am You From The Future! No Time To Explain, Buy This Game noooOH CHRIST!" 

My future self is very happy with having purchased this game.  It will put a smile on your face.  The graphics are simple, but fun.  The controls are simple but fun.  The story is simple but fun.   This leaves you with a game that is simple and fun! 
The story is wacky and fast-paced, don't look for too much here; however this is exactly what a timetravel/parallel dimension based story should be.  Every level and world is just long enough for you to feel satisfied with your success, but short enough that you never feel bogged down, even if you fail and have to retry it.  The worlds are not too long, yet the variety of puzzels changes frequently enough to always be satisfiying. 
The music is good too!  I think I heard a jingle from Top Gear!

TL;DR: Worthwhile game, simple but fun! Get it!

review:
Worth during extreme discount only. Not worth full price.

The wonky controls first introduced in the game are fun and entertaining initially. However, as soon as you make it to the levels where you need some level of percision, the controls make it impossible to do.  Perhaps its not intented for remote play but the controls are the downfall of this game. Also beat the story of this game in only 2 hours. That wouldn't have been an issue, if the first level immidiately available after thecampaign wasn't impossible.
I ended up returning my $3.5 purchase.

review:
Welp, the game is solid 5/10.

There are plenty of things I actually liked in this game, like oldschool flash graphics or crazy plot that doesn't make any sense.

Gameplay is kinda simple - mechanics are fun and intuitive, however the controls make everything bit clunky.

Getting 100% achievs isn't a big deal, the game is short and some harder parts are just frustrating trial/error jumps rather than actual challenging speedruns/YOLO runs.

I don't even know if I'd recommend this game to anyone. I'd like to say why but I've got no time to explain this.

author: {'steamid': '76561198286956439', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 307, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1483152634}
review: Anyone that says the beam gun is inconsistent hasn't spent the time to actually learn the physics and controls of the game. With practice you can become pretty good with the beam gun. This is a hardcore platformer. If you don't like those types of games, you should not play this game. New gameplay elements get added for certain levels to break up the monotony of the beam gun. These types of games can be very satisfying to complete difficult levels. The levels are short and challenging. The bosses are big with weaknesses and patterns to learn. The only thing that I don't like about this game is that there doesn't seem to be anyway to save mid-world. You have to play to and beat the boss before you quit or you're playing the whole world again next time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198064381211', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 198, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 55, 'last_played': 1483070840}
review:
This game is very frustrating and not fun at all. The core mechanic of the game the laser gun is unpredictable and hard to control. The physics feel very wonky. As far as the levels go they are alright, but navigating them with the laser gun is terrible. The game is somewhat forgiving when you die, you just respawn on the last safe ledge you were on. The worlds all end with a boss that is annoying to fight. The bosses don't even have health bars so there is no way to gauge how long you have to suffer through the fight. God forbid you quit to take a break because the game resets your world progress on exit. The story is non-existent and the writing is god awful and relies on "random" humor that was only funny in the early 2000's.

Overall I wouldn't even bother with this game unless you want the trading card drops like me. It isn't boring to play, it's painful to play and a negative experience.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006580639', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 147, 'playtime_forever': 391, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1514405046}
review:
While this game has a some unique mecahnics it has 3 major problems.

1) Lack of a tutorial. It wasn't until the Shotgun guy that I realise I could move my character other than using their weapon.

2) Poor level design in some levels. You automatically respawn on the last land you touched but on some levels it's possible to fall back to a lower level, forcing you to repeat most of the level. Some levels also lack any land so you have to repeat the whole level if you make a single mistake.

3) You can only select a stage but not an individual level. So if you stop playing part way through a stage you have to repeat all the levels in this stage. This is especially annoying when there's a lot of levels or a few are very difficult.

Until you can select levels the player will continue to be punished for giving up half way through a stage.

author: {'steamid': '76561198292316691', 'num_games_owned': 44, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 84, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 22, 'last_played': 1525123501}

author: {'steamid': '76561198217365809', 'num_games_owned': 110, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 248, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 137, 'last_played': 1590234172}
review:
"이런 게임 어때? 보통 게임엔 튜토리얼이 있지만 이 튜토리얼이 진행되기도 전에 게임이 진행되어 버리는거지. 거의 끝에 가서야 튜토리얼이 나오는 거지. 플레이어는 이미 이 게임을 다 꿰뚫고 있는데!"

뭔가 만들 당시 상황이 그려짐. 말할땐 재밌는데 정작 내가 해보니 재미없는 농담같은 게임임.

뭐...그래도 나름 할만함.

author: {'steamid': '76561198324235287', 'num_games_owned': 133, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 162, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 162, 'last_played': 1482486222}
review: 因为有很长时间是挂卡记录的游戏时间，其实游戏时间只有一个半小时，剧情模式难度适中，不过游戏的创意真的是让人感到有趣。有的关卡不仅仅是只能按照固定方向走，也可以自己偷点小聪明，如果想帽子全收集也许会再加上二十几分钟，不过为这个游戏减分的地方正是和这个游戏玩法相关的光标和人物自身的移动。如果说人物移动其实是没有什么必要的也可以，但是最主要的光标移动手感很差！手感很差！手感很差！作为经常玩fps游戏的玩家，面对这款游戏的光标简直想把自己手腕砸断。直到游戏结束我只敢用把光标放在人物正下方。因为其他地方的话完全不能顺利的控制住自己。

author: {'steamid': '76561197961801742', 'num_games_owned': 507, 'num_reviews': 118, 'playtime_forever': 396, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 396, 'last_played': 1469659385}
review:
9/10: Figure out what the heck's going wrong with reality by using your sweet blaster to maneuver and sometimes shoot bosses. A fun platformer with just the right amount of meta to show it isn't taking itself too seriously.

No Time to Explain starts out with the player character warning themselves about future danger before the future copy is snatched away by a giant lobster claw. It only gets wierder from there. Worlds of riches, candy, football, Soviet Union, madness, and more must be overcome by mastering the force exerted from your awesome blaster gun and adapting to the switches in mechanics and environments. 

Any game where getting fat on cake is a platforming mechanic has the right mentality to earn my thumbs up!

author: {'steamid': '76561198015122235', 'num_games_owned': 220, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 18, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 18, 'last_played': 1482257440}
review: Game is essentially unplayable the way it's meant to be played, because the core game element does not work - you're intended to use your beam gun's recoil to move about the map, but it's unbelievably inconsistent in how much recoil it provides you, so while you can with practice predict where the gun will move you, that movement varies over the course of firing the gun, which makes beam-jumping incredibly frustrating in practice.  There's a particular jump I just spent 15 minutes failing to accomplish to acquire a hat, and I am tired of beating my head against the wall when I know exactly what I want to do - the controls just aren't good enough to make it happen (the jump is exceedingly simple - I just need enough height, which the gun can't decide whether or not to provide me with).

author: {'steamid': '76561198063587477', 'num_games_owned': 208, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 24, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 24, 'last_played': 1482249828}

author: {'steamid': '76561198085367707', 'num_games_owned': 779, 'num_reviews': 373, 'playtime_forever': 325, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 171, 'last_played': 1479951167}
review:
Divertido, rápido e desafiador, No Time To Explain é um jogo que nem me lembro de ter comprado, mas joguei e me surpreendi com a diversão que pode ser proporcionada por um jogo relativamente simples.

Tem até uma historinha que se inicia em um dia comum, quando o “Eu” do presente é surpreendido por ninguém menos que “Eu” do futuro, dizendo que não há tempo para explicações, antes de ser subitamente capturado por um caranguejo gigante, deixando apenas sua arma laser pra trás. Cabe ao jogador salvar seu futuro (literalmente) e impedir que os eventos voltem a acontecer.

[spoiler]A história brinca com inúmeras realidades paralelas devido a mudanças na linha do tempo, e em determinado ponto precisamos de uma sala de conferencia para poder reunir todos os “Eu”s do bem e tramar um plano contra mim mesmo do mal.[/spoiler] 

A dificuldade é elevada desde as fases iniciais e aumenta consideravelmente conforme vai se progredindo na campanha, já que os cenários são imperdoáveis, e qualquer erro já é suficiente para te tirar de cena. Felizmente, as fases são bem curtinhas, então ao morrer, não vai ter que repetir muita coisa.

Os controles são simples, contando com apenas três botões, sendo um para movimentar o personagem, outro de pulo e o ultimo da arma laser. No entanto, o funcionamento do laser é pra lá de esquisito, já que além de servir como arma, é também um meio de transporte. Leva um tempo para se acostumar com isso.

Há também um tom cômico na narrativa, que é criado por meio das mais bizarras situações que nos são apresentadas, e pelas frases de efeito do “Eu” do futuro.

Resumindo, No Time to Explain possui um gameplay totalmente maluco. É um jogo simples, porém bastante divertido, pelos seus personagens e situações ridículas. Recomendado para jogadores com dedos, então não espere moleza. BOM (7/10).

author: {'steamid': '76561198041161686', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 168, 'playtime_forever': 132, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 132, 'last_played': 1477305040}
review:
핸들이 반대로 달린 자전거를 타는 기분입니다. 나는 오른쪽으로 가고싶은데 정작 왼쪽으로 입력을 하고있으니
헷갈려서 죽는경우가 많습니다.

게다가 보스에선 공격도 무빙도 동시에 해야되니까 두배로 헷갈립니다

그리고, 패드로는 절대 못할게임.

미묘한 각도를 도저히 패드로 수행할수가 없어요...

author: {'steamid': '76561198123728564', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 59, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 55, 'last_played': 1488031179}
review:
J'ai eu ce jeu dans une loterie et quand j’ai regardé la vidéo dans la boutique steam j’ai bien cru que c’était de la merde ! Mais après quelque session de Gang Beasts en local avec un pote je lui ai proposé d’y jouer en prévenant à l’avance que le jeu pouvais être à chier ^^ .
Mais après quelque minute de jeu on a trouvé ça bien fun ! Le jeu est rigolo l’histoire est totalement incohérente et on s’en bas bien les couilles. Les niveaux sont bien construit et la bande son est pas mauvaise.
On a vraiment apprécié la possibilité de jouer en Coop Local MAIS elle est un peu … hum … moisie la caméra arrive pas à suivre donc si les deux joueurs s’éloignent, elle commence à péter un câble, c’est aussi un de ces jeux de ****** où c’est le premier joueur qui est le plus important donc si le second avance bas il est bloqué par la caméra qui le suivra tous simplement pas.
Après ça reste des petits problèmes, nous en tous cas on en a bien profités (même si des fois le moteur du jeu sature) : petite vidéo de gameplay à deux ci-dessous si vous voulez voir à quoi ça ressemble :
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8QrdBuyroX0

author: {'steamid': '76561198187763383', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 370, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 261, 'last_played': 1499126293}
review:
"No Time To Explain" è un platform semplice e divertente. In alcuni tratti può risultare impegnativo, senza tuttavia essere frustrante. Azzeccata la combinazione arma/propulsore che spinge il giocatore a ragionare prima di agire e non a fare innumerevoli tentativi suicida nella speranza di essere fortunati.
La storia è carina, anche se risulta frenetica e breve... tuttavia non mi sento di criticare questo aspetto, in quanto il titolo stesso del gioco risulta abbastanza chiaro su questo punto.

Molto consigliato.

author: {'steamid': '76561198089620600', 'num_games_owned': 194, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 670, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 525, 'last_played': 1521838805}
review:
The moment I played the demo they put on Newgrounds, I was like, [b]"I gotta have it!"[/b] So I went to buy it and, in my opinion, is one of the best games I've ever played!
It has everything you'd expect from crazy future stuff:
[list]
[*] Lasers
[*] Time-traveling
[*] Crazy monsters 
[*] And, as the title says, no explanation for what's going on
[/list]

This game made me feel like a kid, honest. Especially with the comedy they add to it, makes it for me even more special to me.

author: {'steamid': '76561198072126161', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 368, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 178, 'last_played': 1675581484}
review: Probably the most fun I've had in a unity (and flash) game. The plot is as ludicrous as it is hilarious, every boss is awesome and fun to beat, lazors, the game is challenging and collecting the hats is a fun side-mission and post game. I've had fun with both the original and remastered, so if you like any of the things listed above, you need this game :D

author: {'steamid': '76561198170938887', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 78, 'playtime_forever': 29, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 29, 'last_played': 1478703835}
review:
Her şeyden önce oyunu satın almadığımı söyleyeyim. Nasıl olduğunu bilmediğim bir şekilde steam kütüphaneme düşmüş. 

Yüklerken de ne videosuna baktım, ne de ekran görüntülerine. Beklentisiz: "Hadi bunu da kontrol edeyim." modunda girdim oyuna.

Arkadaşlar platform oyunlarını pek sevmeyen biri olmama rağmen oyun çok eğlenceli. Vakit geçirmek için birebir. Para verip almazdım gerçi ama oynadığım için de pişman değilim. Eğer steam kütüphanenizde varsa ve denemediyseniz mutlaka deneyin. Satın alma konusunda ise türe meraklı arkadaşların belki ilgisini çekecektir. Ancak 24 lirayı hak ettiğini düşünmüyorum. İndirimdeyken almayı tercih edebilirsiniz.

author: {'steamid': '76561198035808481', 'num_games_owned': 1652, 'num_reviews': 87, 'playtime_forever': 612, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 607, 'last_played': 1480968551}
review:
No time to explain is a platformer where the larger part of gameplay consists of you using the recoil of a LAZOR to navigate and sometimes shoot at stuff. I say the larger part because this is also the first part where it shines: gameplay.

There is a surprising amount of different gameplay mechanics and they are why the game stays fresh each level. Perhaps some of them could have been explored further as they go on for like 4 levels and maybe a bossfight and then are dropped again forever. 

Then again the game is very very short all together and can be beat in just a small handful of hours. I think it is too short for full price but adequate at a decent sale. However if you add community created levels you have nigh infinite gametime, so that is nice.

The music is very nice and fitting to the levels. Maybe not a soundtrack you'd buy but one you will totally enjoy.

The story is barely there but there is no time to explain and it isnt neccesary either. 

One last thing: respawn points. This game can be pretty damn tough and you will die quite a lot. However the respawn is always whereever you stood on safe and solid ground last. This isnt too frequent but actually important as it is often that one jump you fail 20 times, so that it is good that all you have to actually do is that one jump. There is a couple of situations with differing gameplay (fire anyone?) where death sets you back much farther and it gets annoying pretty quickly in those cases.

Some decent humor strewn throughout too.

Really if that first trailer convinces you and its cheap at the moment I would totally reccommend you get this.

author: {'steamid': '76561198162196755', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 138, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 138, 'last_played': 1474905611}
review:
Я это ты из будущего, идем и Нет времени объяснять!!!
Ты прибыл из будущего чтобы спасти себя в прошлом, но что-то пошло не так и тебя хватает огромная клешня.
И вот ты из прошлого стоишь и ничего не понимаешь, ты хватаешь оружие и бежишь на выручку к самому же себе
Но ты из будущего умираешь и тебе надо вернутся в прошлое чтобы это предотвратить!!!
Ты врываешься к себе прошлому в квартиру и говришь:
Я это ты из будущего, идем и Нет времени объяснять!!!
......................
......................
Я это ты из будущего, идем и Нет времени объяснять!!!
Гребанная петля времени
отличный 2D платформер, возможнось одевать разные шляпы))
К приобретению рекомендую!

author: {'steamid': '76561198056773776', 'num_games_owned': 308, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 270, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 270, 'last_played': 1474750529}
review: Game has fun concept but it's too annoying to play due to really strange gameplay mechanics and too long boss fights like seriously... You have mostly do same thing 4 times in a boss fight which is problem since some of them has random and total bs movesets and I always lost focus after I did the same thing 3 times in a row and rest of the boss fight was just boring and frustrating in a bad way... I can see that this game is worth only for youtubers/streamers who will get a lot of money from their bored and frustrated faces, also there's not settings so I coulnd't even set it to 1080p fullscren since the game is locked in some weird resolution that  can't be cahnged so you have to look at the annoying frames on both sides...

author: {'steamid': '76561198045427992', 'num_games_owned': 1887, 'num_reviews': 90, 'playtime_forever': 532, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 532, 'last_played': 1474729824}
review:
没时间解释了！快上……哦……不对！快拿上枪，跟现在的你过去的你未来的你艺术家的你精神病人的你总之就是你你你你你你你一起去对抗邪恶的你吧！

一款很有意思的解密类游戏，TINYBUILD的首款游戏。画面很简单、操作很简单，可是趣味性却很强，同时游戏剧情也是各种脑洞大开。不推荐可就说不过去了。

同个开发组还有《SPEEDRUNNER》（撕逼跑者），相信更多的人也玩过这个。

总之，当做一款休闲放松同时也不乏稍稍费脑的好游戏。

8.5/10.0

author: {'steamid': '76561198043675868', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 111, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 111, 'last_played': 1473916513}
review:
I actually have plenty of time to explain this train wreck, and boy do I need it. 

So, a platforming shooter where you use your gun for both damage and movement. Pretty unique concept, and each world uses a unique mechanic to keep things interesting. However, it's riddled with control problems. Most significantly, this is the only platformer of this type that I've played where your crosshair moves WITH your character, so if you're moving quickly it's nigh impossible to aim. What's more, if you move your cursor off the screen it actually goes off the screen. You'd expect it to stay around the edge so you can see where you're aiming, but no. There's also a moronic feature where if you fall a long distance your character lands on his face and has to stand up, preventing you from moving for a second. I don't know if this was added for "comedic" value or to make the game harder, but it feels terrible and goes against the core idea of a platformer.

The level design is just bad and unintuitive. There are so many parts where you need precision and the game isn't capable of being that precise, so you're stuck throwing yourself around until you get the angle just right. At least you aren't punished for dying.

The writing is bland, it's the sort of "random" style that's targeted at kids and young teenagers and typical of a flash game. I won't fault them for that, I know I used to enjoy that type of humour. The music is unremarkable, and I even noticed that they blatantly ripped of a song from an SNES game. Worst of all, somehow the game's optimized poorly enough that I actually dipped below 60fps on occasion, and I don't think I've ever lagged in a flash game before.

I think I got to the second last world before I called it quits. There were more frustrating elements than what I detailed here, just so many terrible design choices and make for a truly frustrating experience. It's playable, so I rate it a 2/10, but it sure isn't fun, and it certainly isn't worth $15.

author: {'steamid': '76561198038897931', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 181, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 181, 'last_played': 1473547574}
review:
Wow, just .. wow!

I thought this game was just a silly prototype/flash game/whatever, but after actually playing it, it's an incredible mix of a platformer, shooter, puzzle game, and various other genres I normally wouldn't even imagine would go together well.

Different mechanics, interesting level design and just-hard-enough bosses, this game isn't boring at any point.
For an additional challenge, try getting all the hats in the game - the challenge isn't finding them, but getting to them :)

A must play!
